Text

MANY years have passed since [[my]0-i wife]144-my wife and [I]0-i left [the United States]145-the united states to pay [our]146-we first visit to [England]1-england . [We]146-we were provided with letters of introduction , as a matter of course . Among them there was a letter which had been written for [us]146-we by [[my]0-i wife ’s brother]147-my wife ’s brother . It presented [us]146-we to [an English gentleman who held a high rank on the list of [[his]148-an english gentleman who held a high rank on the list of his old and valued friends old and valued friends]149-his old and valued friends]148-an english gentleman who held a high rank on the list of his old and valued friends . “ [You]146-we will become acquainted with [Mr. George Germaine]74-mr. germaine , ”[150-my brother - in - law] [[my]0-i brother - in - law]150-my brother - in - law said , when [we]146-we took leave of [him]148-an english gentleman who held a high rank on the list of his old and valued friends , “ at a very interesting period of [his]148-an english gentleman who held a high rank on the list of his old and valued friends life . [My]150-my brother - in - law last news of [him]148-an english gentleman who held a high rank on the list of his old and valued friends tells [me]150-my brother - in - law that [he]148-an english gentleman who held a high rank on the list of his old and valued friends is just married . [I]150-my brother - in - law know nothing of [the lady]2202-the lady , or of the circumstances under which [[my]150-my brother - in - law friend]2203-my friend first met with [her]2202-the lady . But of this [I]150-my brother - in - law am certain : married or single , [George Germaine]74-mr. germaine will give [you]2204-you and [[your]2204-you wife]2205-your wife a hearty welcome to [England]1-england , for [my]150-my brother - in - law sake . ”[150-my brother - in - law] The day after [our]146-we arrival in [London]2-london , [we]146-we left [our]146-we letter of introduction at [the house of [Mr. Germaine]74-mr. germaine]151-the house of mr. germaine . The next morning [we]146-we went to see a favorite object of American interest , in [the metropolis of [England]1-england]152-the metropolis of england — [the Tower of [London]2-london]153-the tower of london . [The citizens of [the United States]145-the united states]154-the citizens of the united states find this relic of the good old times of great use in raising [their]154-the citizens of the united states national estimate of the value of republican institutions . On getting back to [the hotel]156-the hotel , the cards of [Mr.]157-mr. and [Mrs. Germaine]75-mrs. germaine told [us]146-we that [they]154-the citizens of the united states had already returned [our]146-we visit . The same evening [we]146-we received an invitation to dine with [the newly married couple]158-the newly married couple . It was inclosed in a little note from [Mrs. Germaine]75-mrs. germaine to [[my]0-i wife]144-my wife , warning [us]146-we that [we]146-we were not to expect to meet a large party . “ It is the first dinner [we]146-we give , on [our]146-we return from [our]146-we wedding tour ”[2202-the lady] ( [the lady]2202-the lady wrote ) ; “ and [you]162-you will only be introduced to [a few of [[my]2202-the lady husband ’s old friends]2207-my husband ’s old friends]2206-a few of my husband ’s old friends . ”[2202-the lady] In [America]3-america , and ( as [I]0-i hear ) on [the continent of]161-the continent of [Europe]4-europe also , when [[your]162-you host]163-your host invites [you]162-you to dine at a given hour , [you]162-you pay [him]163-your host the compliment of arriving punctually at [[his]163-your host house]164-his house . In [England]1-england alone , the incomprehensible and discourteous custom prevails of keeping [the host]165-the host and the dinner waiting for half an hour or more — without any assignable reason and without any better excuse than the purely formal apology that is implied in the words , “ Sorry to be late . ”[163-your host] Arriving at the appointed time at [the house of [Mr.]167-mr. and [Mrs. Germaine]75-mrs. germaine]166-the house of mr. and mrs. germaine , [we]168-we had every reason to congratulate [ourselves]168-we on the ignorant punctuality which had brought [us]168-we into [the drawing - room]169-the drawing - room half an hour in advance of [the other guests]170-the other guests . In the first place , there was so much heartiness , and so little ceremony , in the welcome accorded to [us]168-we , that [we]168-we almost fancied [ourselves]168-we back in [[our]168-we own country]171-our own country . In the second place , both [husband]172-husband and [wife]173-wife interested [us]168-we the moment [we]168-we set eyes on [them]174-them . [The lady]2202-the lady , especially , although [she]2202-the lady was not , strictly speaking , [a beautiful woman]176-a beautiful woman , quite fascinated [us]168-we . There was an artless charm in [her]2202-the lady face and manner , a simple grace in all [her]2202-the lady movements , a low , delicious melody in [her]2202-the lady voice , which [we]168-we [Americans]76-americans felt to be simply irresistible . And then , it was so plain ( and so pleasant ) to see that here at least was a happy marriage ! Here were [two people who had all [their]177-two people who had all their dearest hopes , wishes , and sympathies in common — who looked , if i may risk the expression , born to be man and wife dearest hopes , wishes , and sympathies in common — who looked , if [I]0-i may risk the expression , born to be [man]178-man and [wife]173-wife]177-two people who had all their dearest hopes , wishes , and sympathies in common — who looked , if i may risk the expression , born to be man and wife . By the time when the fashionable delay of the half hour had expired , [we]168-we were talking together as familiarly and as confidentially as if [we]168-we had been [all four of [[us]168-we old friends]181-us old friends]180-all four of us old friends . Eight o’clock struck , and [the first of [the English guests]183-the english guests]182-the first of the english guests appeared . Having forgotten [this gentleman]184-this gentleman ’s name , [I]0-i must beg leave to distinguish [him]184-this gentleman by means of a letter of the alphabet . Let [me]0-i call [him]184-this gentleman [Mr. A.]77-mr. a. When [he]184-this gentleman entered [the room]185-the room alone , [[our]168-we host]186-our host and [hostess]187-hostess both started , and [both]188-both looked surprised . Apparently [they]188-both expected [him]184-this gentleman to be accompanied by [some other person]189-some other person . [Mr. Germaine]74-mr. germaine put a curious question to [[his]74-mr. germaine friend]190-his friend . “ Where is [[your]74-mr. germaine wife]2205-your wife ? ”[74-mr. germaine] [he]74-mr. germaine asked . [Mr. A]78-mr. a answered for [the absent lady]191-the absent lady by a neat little apology , expressed in these words : “ [She]2205-your wife has got a bad cold . [She]2205-your wife is very sorry . [She]2205-your wife begs [me]78-mr. a to make [her]2205-your wife excuses . ”[78-mr. a] [He]78-mr. a had just time to deliver [his]78-mr. a message , before [another unaccompanied gentleman]192-another unaccompanied gentleman appeared . [She]80-mrs. b begs [me]199-mr. to make [her]80-mrs. b excuses . ”[199-mr.] [Mr.]199-mr. and [Mrs. Germaine]75-mrs. germaine glanced at [one another]200-one another . [The husband]201-the husband ’s face plainly expressed the suspicion which this second apology had roused in [his]201-the husband mind . [The wife]202-the wife was steady and calm . An interval passed — a silent interval . [Mr. A]78-mr. a and [Mr. B]81-mr. b retired together guiltily into a corner . [[My]0-i wife]144-my wife and [I]0-i looked at the pictures . [Mrs. Germaine]75-mrs. germaine was the first to relieve [us]204-we from [our]204-we own intolerable silence . [Two more guests]205-two more guests , it appeared , were still wanting to complete the party . “ Shall [we]204-we have dinner at once , [George]74-mr. germaine ? ”[75-mrs. germaine] [she]75-mrs. germaine said to [[her]75-mrs. germaine husband]206-her husband . “ Or shall [we]204-we wait for [Mr.]2210-mr. and [Mrs. C]82-mrs. c ? ”[75-mrs. germaine] “ [We]204-we will wait five minutes , ”[206-her husband] [he]206-her husband answered , shortly — with [his]206-her husband eye on [Mr. A]78-mr. a and [Mr. B]81-mr. b , guiltily secluded in [their]205-two more guests corner . [The drawing - room]169-the drawing - room door opened . [Our]204-we unexpressed hopes rested silently on the possible appearance of [Mrs. C.]83-mrs. c. Would [that admirable , but unknown , woman]209-that admirable , but unknown , woman , at once charm and relieve [us]204-we by [her]209-that admirable , but unknown , woman presence ? [I]0-i shudder as [I]0-i write it . [Mr. C]84-mr. c walked into [the room]185-the room — and walked in , alone . [Mr. Germaine]74-mr. germaine suddenly varied [his]74-mr. germaine formal inquiry in receiving [the new guest]198-the new guest . “ Is [[your]74-mr. germaine wife]2205-your wife ill ? ”[74-mr. germaine] [he]74-mr. germaine asked . [Mr. C]84-mr. c was [an elderly man]212-an elderly man ; [Mr. C]84-mr. c had lived ( judging by appearances ) in the days when the old - fashioned laws of politeness were still in force . But when [they]2212-your wives are ill , [their]2212-your wives unanimity is wonderful ! ”[74-mr. germaine] The dinner was announced as that sharp saying passed [his]74-mr. germaine lips . [I]0-i had the honor of taking [Mrs. Germaine]75-mrs. germaine to [the dining - room]217-the dining - room . [My]0-i interest in [her]75-mrs. germaine increased tenfold . Only [a woman who had been accustomed to suffer , who had been broken and disciplined to self - restraint]220-a woman who had been accustomed to suffer , who had been broken and disciplined to self - restraint , could have endured the moral martyrdom inflicted on [her]220-a woman who had been accustomed to suffer , who had been broken and disciplined to self - restraint as [this woman]221-this woman endured it , from the beginning of the evening to the end . Am [I]0-i using the language of exaggeration when [I]0-i write of [[my]0-i hostess]222-my hostess in these terms ? Look at the circumstances as [they]223-they struck [two strangers]224-two strangers like [[my]0-i wife]144-my wife and [myself]0-i . Here was the first dinner party which [Mr.]226-mr. and [Mrs. Germaine]75-mrs. germaine had given since [their]227-their marriage . [Three of [[Mr. Germaine]74-mr. germaine ’s friends]229-mr. germaine ’s friends]228-three of mr. germaine ’s friends , [all married men]230-all married men , had been invited with [[their]228-three of mr. germaine ’s friends wives]214-their wives to meet [[Mr. Germaine]74-mr. germaine ’s wife]232-mr. germaine ’s wife , and had ( evidently ) accepted the invitation without reserve . What discoveries had taken place between the giving of the invitation and the giving of the dinner it was impossible to say . The one thing plainly discernible was , that in the interval [the three wives]233-the three wives had agreed in the resolution to leave [[their]233-the three wives husbands]234-their husbands to represent [them]233-the three wives at [Mrs. Germaine]75-mrs. germaine ’s table ; and , more amazing still , [the husbands]235-the husbands had so far approved of the grossly discourteous conduct of [the wives]236-the wives as to consent to make the most insultingly trivial excuses for [their]236-the wives absence . Could any crueler slur than this have been cast on [a woman]237-a woman at the outs et of [her]237-a woman married life , before the face of [[her]237-a woman husband]206-her husband , and in the presence of [two strangers from [another country]240-another country]239-two strangers from another country ? Is “ martyrdom ”[0-i] too big a word to use in describing what [a sensitive person]241-a sensitive person must have suffered , subjected to such treatment as this ? Well , [I]0-i think not . [We]242-we took [our]242-we places at the dinner - table . Do n’t ask [me]0-i to describe that most miserable of mortal meetings , that weariest and dreariest of human festivals ! It is quite bad enough to remember that evening — it is indeed . [[My]0-i wife]144-my wife and [I]0-i did [our]242-we best to keep the conversation moving as easily and as harmlessly as might be . [I]0-i may say that [we]242-we really worked hard . Nevertheless , [our]242-we success was not very encouraging . Try as [we]242-we might to overlook [them]244-them , there were [the three empty places of [the three absent women]246-the three absent women]245-the three empty places of the three absent women , speaking in [their]246-the three absent women own dismal language for [themselves]246-the three absent women . Try as [we]242-we might to resist it , [we]242-we all felt the one sad conclusion which those empty places persisted in forcing on [our]242-we minds . It was surely too plain that some terrible report , affecting the character of [the unhappy woman at the head of the table]247-the unhappy woman at the head of the table , had unexpectedly come to light , and had at one blow destroyed [her]247-the unhappy woman at the head of the table position in the estimation of [[her]247-the unhappy woman at the head of the table husband ’s friends]219-her husband ’s friends . [They]251-the friendliest guests could say good - night at the earliest possible opportunity , and mercifully leave [the married pair]254-the married pair to [themselves]251-the friendliest guests . Let it at least be recorded to the credit of [the three gentlemen]255-the three gentlemen , designated in these pages as A , B , and C , that [they]255-the three gentlemen were sufficiently ashamed of [themselves]255-the three gentlemen and [[their]255-the three gentlemen wives]214-their wives to be [the first members of the dinner party who left [the house]258-the house]257-the first members of the dinner party who left the house . [Mrs. Germaine]75-mrs. germaine earnestly requested that [we]259-you would delay [our]259-you departure . “ Wait a few minutes , ”[75-mrs. germaine] [she]75-mrs. germaine whispered , with a glance at [[her]75-mrs. germaine husband]206-her husband . “ [I]75-mrs. germaine have something to say to [you]201-the husband before [you]201-the husband go . ”[75-mrs. germaine] [She]75-mrs. germaine left [us]259-you , and , taking [Mr. Germaine]74-mr. germaine by the arm , led [him]74-mr. germaine away to the opposite side of [the room]185-the room . [The two]262-the two held a little colloquy together in low voices . [The husband]201-the husband closed the consultation by lifting [the wife]202-the wife ’s hand to [his]201-the husband lips . “ Do as [you]202-the wife please , [[my]201-the husband love]2214-my love , ”[201-the husband] [he]201-the husband said to [her]202-the wife . “ [I]201-the husband leave it entirely to [you]202-the wife . ”[201-the husband] [He]201-the husband sat down sorrowfully , lost in [his]201-the husband thoughts . [Mrs. Germaine]75-mrs. germaine unlocked a cabinet at the further end of [the room]185-the room , and returned to [us]259-you , alone , carrying a small portfolio in [her]75-mrs. germaine hand . “ No words of [mine]75-mrs. germaine can tell [you]259-you how gratefully [I]75-mrs. germaine feel [your]259-you kindness , ”[75-mrs. germaine] [she]75-mrs. germaine said , with perfect simplicity , and with perfect dignity at the same time . “ Under very trying circumstances , [you]259-you have treated [me]75-mrs. germaine with the tenderness and the sympathy which [you]259-you might have shown to [an old friend]2215-an old friend . [She]75-mrs. germaine paused to control [herself]75-mrs. germaine . [We]266-we both begged [her]75-mrs. germaine to say no more . [[Her]75-mrs. germaine husband]206-her husband , joining [us]266-we , added [his]206-her husband entreaties to [ours]266-we . [She]75-mrs. germaine thanked [us]266-we , but [she]75-mrs. germaine persisted . [[My]75-mrs. germaine dear husband]2218-my dear husband — who knows [my]75-mrs. germaine whole life as well as [I]75-mrs. germaine know it [myself]75-mrs. germaine — expressed the wish that [we]266-we should invite [these ladies]2219-these ladies . [He]2218-my dear husband wrongly supposed that [his]2218-my dear husband estimate of [me]75-mrs. germaine would be the estimate accepted by [[his]2218-my dear husband friends]2220-his friends ; and neither [he]2218-my dear husband nor [I]75-mrs. germaine anticipated that the misfortunes of [my]75-mrs. germaine past life would be revealed by [some person acquainted with [them]2217-the other wives , whose treachery [we]266-we have yet to discover]2221-some person acquainted with them , whose treachery we have yet to discover . [They]2217-the other wives are related , without suppression or reserve , in a little narrative which [[my]75-mrs. germaine husband]2225-my husband wrote , at the time of [our]266-we marriage , for the satisfaction of [one of [[his]2225-my husband absent relatives]2227-his absent relatives , whose good opinion [he]2225-my husband was unwilling to forfeit]2226-one of his absent relatives , whose good opinion he was unwilling to forfeit . It is for [you]2222-you to decide , when [you]2222-you know all , whether [I]75-mrs. germaine am [a fit person]2228-a fit person for [an honest woman to associate with]2229-an honest woman to associate with or not . ”[75-mrs. germaine] [She]270-her held out [her]270-her hand , with a sweet , sad smile , and bid [us]271-us good night . [[My]0-i wife]144-my wife , in [her]144-my wife impulsive way , forgot the formalities proper to the occasion , and kissed [her]270-her at parting . At that one little act of sisterly sympathy , the fortitude which [the poor creature]273-the poor creature had preserved all through the evening gave way in an instant . [She]270-her burst into tears . [I]0-i felt as fond of [her]270-her and as sorry for [her]270-her as [[my]0-i wife]144-my wife . But ( unfortunately ) [I]0-i could not take [[my]0-i wife]144-my wife ’s privilege of kissing [her]270-her . On [our]271-us way [downstairs]276-downstairs , [I]0-i found the opportunity of saying a cheering word to [[her]144-my wife husband]206-her husband as [he]206-her husband accompanied [us]271-us to the door . “ Before [I]0-i open this , ”[0-i] [I]0-i remarked , pointing to the portfolio under [my]0-i arm , “ [my]206-her husband mind is made up , [sir]2230-sir , about one thing . If [I]206-her husband was n’t married already , [I]206-her husband tell [you]2230-sir this — [I]206-her husband should envy [you]2230-sir [[your]2230-sir wife]2205-your wife . ”[206-her husband] [He]206-her husband pointed to the portfolio in [his]206-her husband turn . “ Read what [I]206-her husband have written there , ”[206-her husband] [he]206-her husband said ; “ and [you]0-i will understand what [those false friends of mine]2232-those false friends of mine have made [me]206-her husband suffer to - night . ”[206-her husband] The next morning [[my]0-i wife]144-my wife and [I]0-i opened the portfolio , and read the strange story of [George Germaine]74-mr. germaine ’s marriage . LOOK back , [my]0-i memory , through the dim labyrinth of the past , through the mingling joys and sorrows of twenty years . Rise again , [[my]0-i boyhood]279-my boyhood ’s days , by [the winding green shores of [the little lake]281-the little lake]280-the winding green shores of the little lake . Come to [me]0-i once more , [[my]0-i child]282-my child - love , in the innocent beauty of [your]282-my child first ten years of life . Let [us]283-us live again , [[my]0-i angel]284-my angel , as [we]283-us lived in [[our]283-us first paradise]285-our first paradise , before sin and sorrow lifted [their]286-their flaming swords and drove [us]283-us out into [the world]287-the world . The month was March . The last wild fowl of the season were floating on [the waters of [the lake]289-the lake]288-the waters of the lake which , in [[our]283-us Suffolk tongue]290-our suffolk tongue , [we]283-us called [Greenwater Broad]5-greenwater broad . Wind where it might , the grassy banks and the overhanging trees tinged [the lake]289-the lake with the soft green reflections from which [it]289-the lake took its name . In [a creek at the south end]292-a creek at the south end , [the boats]293-the boats were kept — [[my]0-i own pretty sailing boat]294-my own pretty sailing boat having [a tiny natural harbor all to [itself]294-my own pretty sailing boat]295-a tiny natural harbor all to itself . In [a creek at the north end]296-a creek at the north end stood the great trap ( called [a “ decoy ”[298-thousands] )]297-a “ decoy ” ) , used for snaring the wild fowl which flocked every winter , by thousands and [thousands]298-thousands , to [Greenwater Broad]5-greenwater broad . [[My]0-i little [Mary]85-mary]299-my little mary and [I]0-i went out together , hand in hand , to see the last birds of the season lured into [the decoy]300-the decoy . The outer part of the strange bird - trap rose from [the waters of [the lake]289-the lake]288-the waters of the lake in a series of circular arches , formed of elastic branches bent to the needed shape , and covered with folds of fine network , making the roof . Little by little diminishing in size , the arches and [their]303-their net - work followed the secret windings of [the creek]304-the creek inland to [its]304-the creek end . Built back round the arches , on [their]303-their landward side , ran a wooden paling , high enough to hide [a man kneeling behind it from the view of the birds on [the lake]289-the lake]305-a man kneeling behind it from the view of the birds on the lake . At certain intervals a hole was broken in the paling just large enough to allow of the passage through [it]307-it of [a dog of the terrier or the spaniel breed]308-a dog of the terrier or the spaniel breed . And there began and ended the simple yet sufficient mechanism of the decoy . In those days [I]0-i was thirteen , and [Mary]85-mary was ten years old . Walking on [our]309-we way to [the lake]289-the lake [we]309-we had [[Mary]85-mary ’s father]311-mary ’s father with [us]309-we for [guide]312-guide and [companion]313-companion . [The good man]314-the good man served as bailiff on [[[my]0-i father]315-my father ’s estate]316-my father ’s estate . [He]314-the good man was , besides , [a skilled master in the art of decoying ducks]317-a skilled master in the art of decoying ducks . The dog that helped [him]314-the good man ( [we]309-we used no tame ducks as decoys in [Suffolk]6-suffolk ) was [a little black terrier]318-a little black terrier ; [a skilled master]319-a skilled master also , in [his]314-the good man way ; a creature who possessed , in equal proportions , the enviable advantages of perfect good - humor and perfect common sense . The dog followed [the bailiff]320-the bailiff , and [we]309-we followed [the dog]321-the dog . Arrived at the paling which surrounded [the decoy]300-the decoy , the dog sat down to wait until [he]321-the dog was wanted . [The bailiff]320-the bailiff and [the children]324-the children crouched behind the paling , and peeped through the outermost dog - hole , which commanded a full view of [the lake]289-the lake . It was a day without wind ; not a ripple stirred the surface of [the water]326-the water ; the soft gray clouds filled all the sky , and hid the sun from view . [We]309-we peeped through the hole in the paling . There were the wild ducks — collected within easy reach of [the decoy]300-the decoy — placidly dressing their feathers on [the placid surface of [the lake]289-the lake]328-the placid surface of the lake . [The bailiff]320-the bailiff looked at the dog , and made a sign . The dog looked at [the bailiff]320-the bailiff ; and , stepping forward quietly , passed through the hole , so as to show [himself]321-the dog on the narrow strip of ground shelving down from the outer side of [the paling]332-the paling to [the lake]289-the lake . First [one duck]334-one duck , then another , then [half a dozen together]335-half a dozen together , discovered the dog . A new object showing itself on the solitary scene instantly became an object of all - devouring curiosity to the ducks . The outermost of [them]336-they began to swim slowly toward the strange four - footed creature , planted motionless on [the bank]337-the bank . By twos and threes , the main body of the waterfowl gradually followed [the advanced guard]338-the advanced guard . Swimming nearer and nearer to the dog , the wary ducks suddenly came to a halt , and , poised on the water , viewed from a safe distance the phenomenon on [the land]339-the land . [The bailiff , kneeling behind the paling]340-the bailiff , kneeling behind the paling , whispered , “ [Trim]86-trim ! ”[340-the bailiff , kneeling behind the paling] Hearing [his]320-the bailiff name , [the terrier]341-the terrier turned about , and retiring through the hole , became lost to the view of the ducks . Motionless on [the water]326-the water , the wild fowl wondered and waited . In a minute more , the dog had trotted round , and had shown [himself]321-the dog through the next hole in the paling , pierced further inward where [the lake]289-the lake ran up into [the outermost of the windings of [the creek]304-the creek]344-the outermost of the windings of the creek . The second appearance of [the terrier]341-the terrier instantly produced a second fit of curiosity among the ducks . With one accord , [they]336-they swam forward again , to get another and a nearer view of the dog ; then , judging [their]336-they safe distance once more , [they]336-they stopped for the second time , under the outermost arch of the decoy . Again the dog vanished , and the puzzled ducks waited . An interval passed , and the third appearance of [Trim]86-trim took place , through a third hole in the paling , pierced further inland up [the creek]304-the creek . For the third time irresistible curiosity urged the ducks to advance further and further inward , under the fatal arches of [the decoy]300-the decoy . A fourth and a fifth time the game went on , until the dog had lured the water - fowl from point to point into the inner recesses of [the decoy]300-the decoy . There a last appearance of [Trim]86-trim took place . A last advance , a last cautious pause , was made by the ducks . [The bailiff]320-the bailiff touched the strings , the weighed net - work fell vertically into the water , and closed the decoy . There , by dozens and dozens , were the ducks , caught by means of [their]336-they own curiosity — with nothing but a little dog for a bait ! In a few hours afterward [they]336-they were all dead ducks on [their]336-they way to the [London]2-london market . As the last act in the curious comedy of the decoy came to its end , [little Mary]85-mary laid [her]85-mary hand on [my]0-i shoulder , and , raising [herself]85-mary on tiptoe , whispered in [my]0-i ear : “ [George]74-mr. germaine , come [home]2233-home with [me]85-mary . [I]85-mary have got something to show [you]74-mr. germaine that is better worth seeing than the ducks . ”[85-mary] “ What is it ? ”[85-mary] “ It ’s a surprise . [I]85-mary wo n’t tell [you]74-mr. germaine . ”[85-mary] “ Will [you]74-mr. germaine give [me]351-the charming little creature a kiss ? ”[351-the charming little creature] [The charming little creature]351-the charming little creature put [her]351-the charming little creature slim sun - burned arms round [my]0-i neck , and answered : “ As many kisses as [you]74-mr. germaine like , [George]74-mr. germaine . ”[351-the charming little creature] It was innocently said , on [her]351-the charming little creature side . It was innocently done , on [mine]0-i . [The good easy bailiff]352-the good easy bailiff , looking aside at the moment from [his]352-the good easy bailiff ducks , discovered [us]353-us pursuing [our]353-us boy - and - girl courtship in [each other]354-each other ’s arms . [He]352-the good easy bailiff shook [his]352-the good easy bailiff big forefinger at [us]353-us , with something of a sad and doubting smile . “ Ah , [Master George]74-mr. germaine , [Master George]74-mr. germaine ! ”[352-the good easy bailiff] [he]352-the good easy bailiff said . “ When [[your]0-i father]2234-your father comes [home]2233-home , do [you]0-i think [he]2234-your father will approve of [[his]2234-your father son]2236-his son and heir kissing [[his]2234-your father bailiff ’s daughter]2237-his bailiff ’s daughter ? ”[352-the good easy bailiff] “ When [[my]0-i father]315-my father comes [home]2233-home , ”[0-i] [I]0-i answered , with great dignity , “ [I]0-i shall tell [him]2234-your father the truth . [I]0-i shall say [I]0-i am going to marry [[your]320-the bailiff daughter]2240-your daughter . ”[0-i] [The bailiff]320-the bailiff burst out laughing , and looked back again at [his]320-the bailiff ducks . “ Well , well ! ”[320-the bailiff] [we]356-we heard [him]320-the bailiff say to [himself]320-the bailiff . “ [They]357-children ’re [only children]2241-only children . There ’s no call , poor things , to part [them]357-children yet awhile . ”[320-the bailiff] [Mary]85-mary and [I]0-i had a great dislike to be called [children]357-children . Properly understood , [one of [us]356-we]358-one of us was [a lady aged ten]359-a lady aged ten , and [the other]360-the other was [a gentleman aged thirteen]361-a gentleman aged thirteen . [We]356-we left [the good bailiff]362-the good bailiff indignantly , and went away together , hand in hand , to [the cottage]363-the cottage . “ [HE]320-the bailiff is growing too fast , ”[364-the doctor] said [the doctor]364-the doctor to [[my]0-i mother]365-my mother ; “ and [he]320-the bailiff is getting a great deal too clever for [a boy]2242-a boy at [his]320-the bailiff age . Remove [him]320-the bailiff from [school]2243-school , [ma’am]2244-ma’am , for six months ; let [him]320-the bailiff run about in the open air at [home]2233-home ; and if [you]365-my mother find [him]320-the bailiff with a book in [his]320-the bailiff hand , take it away directly . There is [my]364-the doctor prescription . ”[364-the doctor] Those words decided [my]0-i fate in life . In obedience to [the doctor]364-the doctor ’s advice , [I]0-i was left [an idle boy]367-an idle boy — without [brothers]368-brothers , [sisters]369-sisters , or companions of [my]0-i own age — to roam about [the grounds of [[our]371-we lonely country - house]372-our lonely country - house]370-the grounds of our lonely country - house . [[The bailiff]320-the bailiff ’s daughter]374-the bailiff ’s daughter , like [me]0-i , was [an only child]375-an only child ; and , like [me]0-i , [she]374-the bailiff ’s daughter had no playfellows . [We]371-we met in [our]371-we wanderings on [the solitary shores of [the lake]289-the lake]376-the solitary shores of the lake . Beginning by being [inseparable companions]378-inseparable companions , [we]371-we ripened and developed into [true lovers]379-true lovers . [Our]371-we preliminary courtship concluded , [we]371-we next proposed ( before [I]0-i returned to [school]2243-school ) to burst into complete maturity by becoming [man]178-man and [wife]173-wife . [I]0-i am not writing in jest . Absurd as it may appear to “ [sensible people]2246-sensible people , ”[385-lovers] [[we]371-we [two children]384-two children]383-we two children were [lovers]385-lovers , if ever there were [lovers]385-lovers yet . [We]371-we had no pleasures apart from the one all - sufficient pleasure which [we]371-we found in each other ’s society . [We]371-we objected to the night , because it parted [us]371-we . [We]371-we entreated [[our]371-we parents]387-our parents , on either side , to let [us]371-we sleep in [the same room]388-the same room . [I]0-i was angry with [[my]0-i mother]365-my mother , and [Mary]85-mary was disappointed in [[her]85-mary father]390-her father , when [they]387-our parents laughed at [us]371-we , and wondered what [we]371-we should want next . Looking onward , from those days to the days of [my]0-i manhood , [I]0-i can vividly recall such hours of happiness as have fallen to [my]0-i share . But [I]0-i remember no delights of that later time comparable to the exquisite and enduring pleasure that filled [my]0-i young being when [I]0-i walked with [Mary]85-mary in [the woods]391-the woods ; when [I]0-i sailed with [Mary]85-mary in [[my]0-i boat]392-my boat on [the lake]289-the lake ; when [I]0-i met [Mary]85-mary , after the cruel separation of the night , and flew into [her]85-mary open arms as if [we]371-we had been parted for months and months together . What was the attraction that drew [us]371-we so closely one to the other , at an age when the sexual sympathies lay dormant in [her]85-mary and in [me]0-i ? [We]371-we neither knew nor sought to know . [We]371-we obeyed the impulse to love [one another]200-one another , as a bird obeys the impulse to fly . Let it not be supposed that [we]371-we possessed any natural gifts , or advantages which singled [us]371-we out as differing in a marked way from [other children]395-other children at [our]371-we time of life . [We]371-we possessed nothing of the sort . [I]0-i had been called [a clever boy at school]396-a clever boy at school ; but there were [thousands of other boys]397-thousands of other boys , at thousands of other schools , who headed [their]397-thousands of other boys classes and won [their]397-thousands of other boys prizes , like [me]0-i . Personally speaking , [I]0-i was in no way remarkable — except for being , in the ordinary phrase , “ tall for [my]85-mary age . ”[85-mary] On [her]85-mary side , [Mary]85-mary displayed no striking attractions . [She]85-mary was [a fragile child , with mild gray eyes and a pale complexion]398-a fragile child , with mild gray eyes and a pale complexion ; singularly undemonstrative , singularly shy and silent , except when [she]85-mary was alone with [me]0-i . Such beauty as [she]85-mary had , in those early days , lay in a certain artless purity and tenderness of expression , and in the charming reddish - brown color of [her]85-mary hair , varying quaintly and prettily in different lights . To all outward appearance [two perfectly commonplace children]399-two perfectly commonplace children , [we]371-we were mysteriously united by some kindred association of the spirit in [her]85-mary and the spirit in [me]0-i , which not only defied discovery by [[our]371-we young selves]400-our young selves , but which lay too deep for investigation by far older and far wiser heads than [ours]371-we . [You]401-you will naturally wonder whether anything was done by [[our]371-we elders]402-our elders to check [our]371-we precocious attachment , while it was still an innocent love union between [a boy]2242-a boy and [a girl]404-a girl . Nothing was done by [[my]0-i father]315-my father , for the simple reason that [he]315-my father was away from [home]2233-home . [He]315-my father was [a man of a restless and speculative turn of mind]407-a man of a restless and speculative turn of mind . Inheriting [his]315-my father estate burdened with debt , [his]315-my father grand ambition was to increase [his]315-my father small available income by [his]315-my father own exertions ; to set up [an establishment in [London]2-london]408-an establishment in london ; and to climb to political distinction by the ladder of [Parliament]7-parliament . [An old friend]2215-an old friend , who had emigrated to [America]3-america , had proposed to [him]315-my father a speculation in agriculture , in [one of [the Western States]411-the western states]410-one of the western states , which was to make both [their]412-their fortunes . [[My]0-i father]315-my father ’s eccentric fancy was struck by the idea . For more than a year past [he]315-my father had been away from [us]414-us in [the United States]145-the united states ; and all [we]414-us knew of [him]315-my father ( instructed by [his]315-my father letters ) was , that [he]315-my father might be shortly expected to return to [us]414-us in the enviable character of [one of [the richest men in [England]1-england]417-the richest men in england]416-one of the richest men in england . As for [[my]0-i poor mother]418-my poor mother — [the sweetest and softest - hearted of [women]420-women]419-the sweetest and softest - hearted of women — to see [me]0-i happy was all that [she]418-my poor mother desired . The quaint little love romance of [the two children]421-the two children amused and interested [her]418-my poor mother . [She]418-my poor mother jested with [[Mary]85-mary ’s father]311-mary ’s father about the coming union between [the two families]423-the two families , without one serious thought of the future — without even a foreboding of what might happen when [[my]0-i father]315-my father returned . “ Sufficient for the day is the evil ( or the good ) thereof , ”[365-my mother] had been [[my]0-i mother]365-my mother ’s motto all [her]418-my poor mother life . [She]418-my poor mother agreed with the easy philosophy of [the bailiff]320-the bailiff , already recorded in these pages : “ [They]2247-they ’re [only children]2241-only children . There ’s no call , poor things , to part [them]2247-they yet a while . ”[418-my poor mother] There was [one member of [the family]428-the family]427-one member of the family , however , who took a sensible and serious view of the matter . [[[My]0-i father]315-my father ’s brother]430-my father ’s brother paid [us]431-us a visit in [[our]431-us solitude]432-our solitude ; discovered what was going on between [Mary]85-mary and [me]0-i ; and was , at first , naturally enough , inclined to laugh at [us]431-us . [Closer]87-closer investigation altered [his]430-my father ’s brother way of thinking . [He]430-my father ’s brother became convinced that [[my]0-i mother]365-my mother was acting like [a fool]434-a fool ; that [the bailiff]320-the bailiff ( [a faithful servant]436-a faithful servant , if ever there was one yet ) was cunningly advancing [his]320-the bailiff own interests by means of [[his]320-the bailiff daughter]437-his daughter ; and that [I]0-i was [a young idiot]438-a young idiot , who had developed [his]430-my father ’s brother native reserves of imbecility at an unusually early period of life . Speaking to [[my]0-i mother]365-my mother under the influence of these strong impressions , [[my]0-i uncle]440-my uncle offered to take [me]0-i back with [him]440-my uncle to [London]2-london , and keep [me]0-i [there]441-there until [I]0-i had been brought to [my]0-i senses by association with [[his]440-my uncle own children]442-his own children , and by careful superintendence under [his]440-my uncle own roof . [[My]0-i mother]365-my mother hesitated about accepting this proposal ; [she]365-my mother had the advantage over [[my]0-i uncle]440-my uncle of understanding [my]0-i disposition . While [she]365-my mother was still doubting , while [[my]0-i uncle]440-my uncle was still impatiently waiting for [her]365-my mother decision , [I]0-i settled the question for [[my]0-i elders]446-my elders by running away . [I]0-i left a letter to represent [me]0-i in [my]0-i absence ; declaring that no mortal power should part [me]0-i from [Mary]85-mary , and promising to return and ask [[my]0-i mother]365-my mother ’s pardon as soon as [[my]0-i uncle]440-my uncle had left [the house]258-the house . The strictest search was made for [me]0-i without discovering a trace of [my]0-i place of refuge . [[My]0-i uncle]440-my uncle departed for [London]2-london , predicting that [I]0-i should live to be a disgrace to [the family]428-the family , and announcing that [he]440-my uncle should transmit [his]440-my uncle opinion of [me]0-i to [[my]0-i father]315-my father in [America]3-america by the next mail . The secret of the hiding - place in which [I]0-i contrived to defy discovery is soon told . [I]0-i was hidden ( without [the bailiff]320-the bailiff ’s knowledge ) in [the bedroom of [[the bailiff]320-the bailiff ’s mother]456-the bailiff ’s mother]454-the bedroom of the bailiff ’s mother . And did [[the bailiff]320-the bailiff ’s mother]456-the bailiff ’s mother know it ? [you]459-you will ask . To which [I]0-i answer : [[the bailiff]320-the bailiff ’s mother]456-the bailiff ’s mother did it . And , what is more , gloried in doing it — not , observe , as an act of hostility to [[my]0-i relatives]462-my relatives , but simply as a duty that lay on [her]456-the bailiff ’s mother conscience . What sort of [old woman]463-old woman , in the name of all that is wonderful , was this ? Let [her]456-the bailiff ’s mother appear , and speak for [herself]456-the bailiff ’s mother — [the wild and weird grandmother of [gentle little Mary]85-mary]464-the wild and weird grandmother of gentle little mary ; [the Sibyl of modern times]465-the sibyl of modern times , known , far and wide , in [[our]466-our part of [Suffolk]6-suffolk]467-our part of suffolk , as [Dame Dermody]88-dame dermody . [I]0-i see [her]456-the bailiff ’s mother again , as [I]0-i write , sitting in [[[her]456-the bailiff ’s mother son]468-her son ’s [pretty cottage parlor]470-pretty cottage parlor]469-her son ’s pretty cottage parlor , hard by the window , so that the light fell over [her]456-the bailiff ’s mother shoulder while [she]456-the bailiff ’s mother knitted or read . [A little , lean , wiry old woman]471-a little , lean , wiry old woman was [Dame Dermody]88-dame dermody — with fierce black eyes , surmounted by bushy white eyebrows , by a high wrinkled forehead , and by thick white hair gathered neatly under [her]456-the bailiff ’s mother old - fashioned “ mob - cap . ”[89-report] [Report]89-report whispered ( and whispered truly ) that [she]456-the bailiff ’s mother had been [a lady by birth and breeding]472-a lady by birth and breeding , and that [she]456-the bailiff ’s mother had deliberately closed [her]456-the bailiff ’s mother prospects in life by marrying [a man greatly [[her]456-the bailiff ’s mother inferior]474-her inferior in social rank]473-a man greatly her inferior in social rank . Whatever [[her]456-the bailiff ’s mother family]475-her family might think of [her]456-the bailiff ’s mother marriage , [she]456-the bailiff ’s mother [herself]456-the bailiff ’s mother never regretted it . In [her]456-the bailiff ’s mother estimation [[her]456-the bailiff ’s mother husband]206-her husband ’s memory was a sacred memory ; [his]206-her husband spirit was a guardian spirit , watching over [her]456-the bailiff ’s mother , waking or sleeping , morning or night . Holding this faith , [she]456-the bailiff ’s mother was in no respect influenced by those grossly material ideas of modern growth which associate the presence of [spiritual beings]477-spiritual beings with clumsy conjuring tricks and monkey antics performed on tables and chairs . [Dame Dermody]88-dame dermody ’s nobler superstition formed an integral part of [her]456-the bailiff ’s mother religious convictions — convictions which had long since found their chosen resting - place in the mystic doctrines of [Emanuel Swedenborg]90-emanuel swedenborg . The only books which [she]456-the bailiff ’s mother read were the works of [the Swedish Seer]91-the swedish seer . [She]456-the bailiff ’s mother mixed up [Swedenborg]90-emanuel swedenborg ’s teachings on [angels and departed spirits]478-angels and departed spirits , on love to [[one]479-one ’s neighbor]480-one ’s neighbor and purity of life , with wild fancies , and kindred beliefs of [her]456-the bailiff ’s mother own ; and preached the visionary religious doctrines thus derived , not only in [[the bailiff]320-the bailiff ’s household]482-the bailiff ’s household , but also on proselytizing expeditions to [the households of [[her]456-the bailiff ’s mother humble neighbors]484-her humble neighbors , far and near]483-the households of her humble neighbors , far and near . Under [[[her]456-the bailiff ’s mother son]468-her son ’s roof]486-her son ’s roof — after the death of [[his]468-her son wife]215-his wife — [she]456-the bailiff ’s mother reigned a supreme power ; priding [herself]456-the bailiff ’s mother alike on [her]456-the bailiff ’s mother close attention to [her]456-the bailiff ’s mother domestic duties , and on [her]456-the bailiff ’s mother privileged communications with angels and [spirits]488-spirits . [She]456-the bailiff ’s mother would hold long colloquys with the spirit of [[her]456-the bailiff ’s mother dead husband]489-her dead husband before [anybody who happened to be present]490-anybody who happened to be present — colloquys which struck [the simple spectators]491-the simple spectators mute with terror . To [her]456-the bailiff ’s mother mystic view , the love union between [Mary]85-mary and [me]0-i was something too sacred and too beautiful to be tried by the mean and matter - of - fact tests set up by [society]492-society . [She]456-the bailiff ’s mother wrote for [us]493-we little formulas of prayer and praise , which [we]493-we were to use when [we]493-we met and when [we]493-we parted , day by day . [She]456-the bailiff ’s mother solemnly warned [[her]456-the bailiff ’s mother son]468-her son to look upon [us]493-we as [two young consecrated creatures]495-two young consecrated creatures , walking unconsciously on a heavenly path of [their]495-two young consecrated creatures own , whose beginning was on [earth]496-earth , but whose bright end was among [the angels in a better state of being]497-the angels in a better state of being . Imagine [my]0-i appearing before [such a woman as this]498-such a woman as this , and telling [her]456-the bailiff ’s mother with tears of despair that [I]0-i was determined to die , rather than let [[my]0-i uncle]440-my uncle part [me]0-i from little [Mary]85-mary , and [you]500-you will no longer be astonished at the hospitality which threw open to [me]0-i [the sanctuary of [[Dame Dermody]88-dame dermody ’s own room]502-dame dermody ’s own room]501-the sanctuary of dame dermody ’s own room . When the safe time came for leaving [my]0-i hiding - place , [I]0-i committed a serious mistake . In thanking [the old woman]503-the old woman at parting , [I]0-i said to [her]503-the old woman ( with [a boy]2242-a boy ’s sense of honor ) , “ [I]0-i wo n’t tell upon [you]503-the old woman , [Dame]88-dame dermody . [[My]0-i mother]365-my mother sha n’t know that [you]503-the old woman hid [me]0-i in [[your]503-the old woman bedroom]2250-your bedroom . ”[0-i] [The Sibyl]92-the sibyl laid [her]92-the sibyl dry , fleshless hand on [my]0-i shoulder , and forced [me]0-i roughly back into the chair from which [I]0-i had just risen . “ [Boy]2251-boy ! ”[92-the sibyl] [she]92-the sibyl said , looking through and through [me]0-i with [her]92-the sibyl fierce black eyes . “ Do [you]2251-boy dare suppose that [I]92-the sibyl ever did anything that [I]92-the sibyl was ashamed of ? Do [you]2251-boy think [I]92-the sibyl am ashamed of what [I]92-the sibyl have done now ? Wait there . [[Your]2251-boy mother]2252-your mother may mistake [me]92-the sibyl too . [I]92-the sibyl shall write to [[your]2251-boy mother]2252-your mother . ”[92-the sibyl] [She]92-the sibyl put on [her]92-the sibyl great round spectacles with tortoise - shell rims and sat down to [her]92-the sibyl letter . Whenever [her]92-the sibyl thoughts flagged , whenever [she]92-the sibyl was at a loss for an expression , [she]92-the sibyl looked over [her]92-the sibyl shoulder , as if some visible creature were stationed behind [her]92-the sibyl , watching what [she]92-the sibyl wrote ; consulted the spirit of [[her]92-the sibyl husband]206-her husband , exactly as [she]92-the sibyl might have consulted [a living man]506-a living man ; smiled softly to [herself]92-the sibyl , and went on with [her]92-the sibyl writing . “ There ! ”[92-the sibyl] [she]92-the sibyl said , handing [me]0-i the completed letter with an imperial gesture of indulgence . “ [His]206-her husband mind and [my]92-the sibyl mind are written there . Go , [boy]2251-boy . [I]92-the sibyl pardon [you]2251-boy . Give [my]92-the sibyl letter to [[your]2251-boy mother]2252-your mother . ”[92-the sibyl] So [she]92-the sibyl always spoke , with the same formal and measured dignity of manner and language . [I]0-i gave the letter to [[my]0-i mother]365-my mother . [We]508-we read it , and marveled over it together . Thus , counseled by the ever - present spirit of [[her]92-the sibyl husband]206-her husband , [Dame Dermody]88-dame dermody wrote : “ [MADAM]2256-madam — [I]88-dame dermody have taken what [you]2256-madam may be inclined to think a great liberty . [I]88-dame dermody have assisted [[your]2256-madam son]2257-your son [George]74-mr. germaine in setting [[his]74-mr. germaine uncle]2258-his uncle ’s authority at defiance . [I]88-dame dermody have encouraged [[your]2256-madam son]2257-your son [George]74-mr. germaine in [his]74-mr. germaine resolution to be true , in time and in eternity , to [[my]88-dame dermody grandchild]2260-my grandchild , [Mary Dermody]85-mary . “[88-dame dermody] It is due to [you]510-you and to [me]0-i that [I]0-i should tell [you]510-you with what motive [I]0-i have acted in doing these things . “ [I]0-i hold the belief that all love that is true is foreordained and consecrated in [heaven]2261-heaven . Spirits destined to be united in [the better world]2262-the better world are divinely commissioned to discover [each other]354-each other and to begin [their]511-the kindred spirits union in [this world]2264-this world . The only happy marriages are those in which [the two destined spirits]2265-the two destined spirits have succeeded in meeting [one another]200-one another in this sphere of life . “[0-i] When [the kindred spirits]511-the kindred spirits have once met , [no human power]512-no human power can really part [them]511-the kindred spirits . Sooner or later , [they]511-the kindred spirits must , by divine law , find [each other]354-each other again and become [united spirits]514-united spirits once more . Worldly wisdom may force [them]511-the kindred spirits into widely different ways of life ; worldly wisdom may delude [them]511-the kindred spirits , or may make [them]511-the kindred spirits delude [themselves]511-the kindred spirits , into contracting an earthly and a fallible union . It matters nothing . The time will certainly come when that union will manifest itself as earthly and fallible ; and [the two disunited spirits]515-the two disunited spirits , finding [each other]354-each other again , will become united here for [the world beyond this]517-the world beyond this — united , [I]0-i tell [you]518-you , in defiance of all human laws and of all human notions of right and wrong . “ This is [my]0-i belief . [I]0-i have proved it by [my]0-i own life . [Maid]2267-maid , [wife]173-wife , and [widow]2269-widow , [I]0-i have held to it , and [I]0-i have found it good . “[0-i] [I]0-i was born , [madam]2256-madam , in the rank of society to which [you]518-you belong . [I]0-i received the mean , material teaching which fulfills the worldly notion of education . Thanks be to [God]93-god , [my]0-i kindred spirit met [my]0-i spirit while [I]0-i was still young . [I]0-i knew true love and true union before [I]0-i was twenty years of age . [I]0-i married , [madam]2256-madam , in the rank from which [Christ]94-christ chose [[his]94-christ apostles]521-his apostles — [I]0-i married [a laboring - man]522-a laboring - man . No human language can tell [my]0-i happiness while [we]523-we lived united here . [His]522-a laboring - man death has not parted [us]523-we . [He]522-a laboring - man helps [me]0-i to write this letter . In [my]0-i last hours [I]0-i shall see [him]522-a laboring - man standing among the angels , waiting for [me]0-i on [the banks of [the shining river]525-the shining river]524-the banks of the shining river . “ [You]526-your will now understand the view [I]522-a laboring - man take of the tie which unites [the young spirits of [[our]523-we children]2271-our children]2270-the young spirits of our children at the bright outset of [their]2270-the young spirits of our children lives . “[522-a laboring - man] Believe [me]0-i , the thing which [[[your]526-your husband]527-your husband ’s brother]528-your husband ’s brother has proposed to [you]526-your to do is a sacrilege and a profanation . [I]0-i own to [you]526-your freely that [I]0-i look on what [I]0-i have done toward thwarting [[your]526-your relative]529-your relative in this matter as an act of virtue . [You]526-your can not expect [me]0-i to think it a serious obstacle to a union predestined in [heaven]2261-heaven , that [[your]526-your son]2257-your son is [[the squire]532-the squire ’s heir]533-the squire ’s heir , and that [[my]0-i grandchild]2260-my grandchild is only [[the bailiff]320-the bailiff ’s daughter]374-the bailiff ’s daughter . Dismiss from [your]526-your mind , [I]0-i implore [you]526-your , the unworthy and unchristian prejudices of rank . Are [we]537-we not all equal before [God]93-god ? Are [we]537-we not all equal ( even in [this world]2264-this world ) before disease and death ? Not [[your]526-your son]2257-your son ’s happiness only , but [your]526-your own peace of mind , is concerned in taking heed to [my]0-i words . [I]0-i warn [you]526-your , [madam]2256-madam , [you]526-your can not hinder the destined union of [these two child - spirits]541-these two child - spirits , in after - years , as [man]178-man and [wife]173-wife . Part [them]541-these two child - spirits now — and [YOU]526-your will be responsible for the sacrifices , degradations and distresses through which [[your]526-your [George]74-mr. germaine]544-your george and [[my]0-i Mary]545-my mary may be condemned to pass on [their]541-these two child - spirits way back to [each other]354-each other in later life . “ Now [my]526-your mind is unburdened . Now [I]526-your have said all . “[526-your] If [I]0-i have spoken too freely , or have in any other way unwittingly offended , [I]0-i ask [your]526-your pardon , and remain , [madam]2256-madam , [[your]526-your faithful servant and well - wisher]548-your faithful servant and well - wisher , [HELEN DERMODY]95-helen dermody . ” So the letter ended . To [me]95-helen dermody it is something more than a mere curiosity of epistolary composition . [I]95-helen dermody see in it the prophecy — strangely fulfilled in later years — of events in [Mary]85-mary ’s life , and in [mine]95-helen dermody , which future pages are now to tell . [[My]95-helen dermody mother]365-my mother decided on leaving the letter unanswered . Like [many of [[her]365-my mother poorer neighbors]2274-her poorer neighbors]2273-many of her poorer neighbors , [she]365-my mother was a little afraid of [Dame Dermody]88-dame dermody ; and [she]365-my mother was , besides , habitually averse to all discussions which turned on the mysteries of spiritual life . [I]95-helen dermody was reproved , admonished , and forgiven ; and there was the end of it . For some happy weeks [Mary]85-mary and [I]95-helen dermody returned , without hinderance or interruption , to [our]2275-we old intimate companionship The end was coming , however , when [we]2275-we least expected it . [[My]95-helen dermody mother]365-my mother was startled , one morning , by a letter from [[my]95-helen dermody father]315-my father , which informed [her]365-my mother that [he]315-my father had been unexpectedly obliged to sail for [England]1-england at a moment ’s notice ; that [he]315-my father had arrived in [London]2-london , and that [he]315-my father was detained [there]441-there by business which would admit of no delay . [We]2275-we were to wait for [him]315-my father at [home]2233-home , in daily expectation of seeing [him]315-my father the moment [he]315-my father was free . This news filled [[my]95-helen dermody mother]365-my mother ’s mind with foreboding doubts of the stability of [[her]365-my mother husband]206-her husband ’s grand speculation in [America]3-america . The sudden departure from [the United States]8-the united states , and the mysterious delay in [London]2-london , were ominous , to [her]365-my mother eyes , of misfortune to come . [I]95-helen dermody am now writing of those dark days in the past , when the railway and the electric telegraph were still visions in the minds of [inventors]2282-inventors . Rapid communication with [[my]95-helen dermody father]315-my father ( even if [he]315-my father would have consented to take [us]2275-we into [his]315-my father confidence ) was impossible . [We]2275-we had no choice but to wait and hope . The weary days passed ; and still [[my]95-helen dermody father]315-my father ’s brief letters described [him]315-my father as detained by [his]315-my father business . The morning came when [Mary]85-mary and [I]95-helen dermody went out with [Dermody]85-mary , [the bailiff]320-the bailiff , to see the last wild fowl of the season lured into the decoy ; and still [the welcome home]2286-the welcome home waited for [the master]2287-the master , and waited in vain . The narrative may now follow [[my]95-helen dermody little sweetheart]2288-my little sweetheart and [myself]95-helen dermody , on [our]2275-we way to [[Dermody]85-mary 's cottage]2289-dermody 's cottage As [we]2275-we approached the garden gate , [I]95-helen dermody saw [a servant from [the house]258-the house]2290-a servant from the house waiting there . [He]2290-a servant from the house carried a message from [[my]95-helen dermody mother]365-my mother — a message for [me]95-helen dermody . “[95-helen dermody] [[My]0-i mistress]549-my mistress wishes [you]550-you to go [home]2233-home , [Master George]74-mr. germaine , as soon as [you]550-you can . A letter has come by [the coach]552-the coach . [[My]0-i master]553-my master means to take a post - chaise from [London]2-london , and sends word that [we]554-we may expect [him]553-my master in the course of the day . ” [Mary]85-mary ’s attentive face saddened when [she]85-mary heard those words . “[0-i] Must [you]550-you really go away , [George]74-mr. germaine , ” [she]0-i whispered , “[74-mr. germaine] before [you]550-you see what [I]0-i have got waiting for [you]550-you at [home]2233-home ? ” [I]0-i remembered [Mary]85-mary ’s promised “[0-i] surprise , ” the secret of which was only to be revealed to [me]0-i when [we]554-we got to [the cottage]363-the cottage . How could [I]0-i disappoint [her]85-mary ? [[My]0-i poor little lady - love]2294-my poor little lady - love looked ready to cry at the bare prospect of it . [I]0-i dismissed [the servant]2295-the servant with a message of the temporizing sort . [My]0-i love to [[my]0-i mother]365-my mother — and [I]0-i would be back at [the house]258-the house in half an hour . [We]554-we entered [the cottage]363-the cottage . [Dame Dermody]88-dame dermody was sitting in the light of the window , as usual , with one of the mystic books of [Emanuel Swedenborg]90-emanuel swedenborg open on [her]88-dame dermody lap . [She]88-dame dermody solemnly lifted [her]88-dame dermody hand on [our]554-we appearance , signing to [us]554-we to occupy [our]554-we customary corner without speaking to [her]88-dame dermody . It was an act of domestic high treason to interrupt [the Sibyl]2299-the sibyl at [her]88-dame dermody books . [We]554-we crept quietly into [[our]554-we places]2300-our places . [Mary]85-mary waited until [she]85-mary saw [[her]85-mary grandmother]2301-her grandmother ’s gray head bend down , and [[her]85-mary grandmother]2301-her grandmother ’s bushy eyebrows contract attentively , over [her]88-dame dermody reading . Then , and then only , [the discreet child]2303-the discreet child rose on tiptoe , disappeared noiselessly in the direction of [[her]88-dame dermody bedchamber]2304-her bedchamber , and came back to [me]0-i carrying something carefully wrapped up in [her]88-dame dermody best cambric handkerchief . “[0-i] Is that the surprise ? ” [I]0-i whispered . [Mary]85-mary whispered back : “[0-i] Guess what it is ? ” “[0-i] Something for [me]0-i ? ” “[0-i] Yes . Go on guessing . What is it ? ” [I]0-i guessed three times , and each guess was wrong . [Mary]85-mary decided on helping [me]0-i by a hint . “[0-i] Say [your]556-you letters , ” [she]85-mary suggested ; “[556-you] and go on till [I]0-i stop [you]556-you . ” [I]0-i began : “[0-i] A , B , C , D , E , F — ” There [she]85-mary stopped [me]0-i . “[0-i] It ’s the name of a Thing , ” [she]85-mary said ; “[0-i] and it begins with F. ” [I]96-fern guessed , “[96-fern] [Fern]96-fern , ” “[97-feather] [Feather]97-feather , ” “[98-fife] [Fife]98-fife . ” And here [my]98-fife resources failed [me]98-fife . [Mary]85-mary sighed , and shook [her]85-mary head . “[98-fife] [You]556-you do n’t take pains , ” [she]85-mary said . “[556-you] [You]556-you are three whole years older than [I]0-i am . After all the trouble [I]0-i have taken to please [you]556-you , [you]556-you may be too big to care for [my]0-i present when [you]556-you see it . Guess again . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i ca n’t guess . ” “[556-you] [You]556-you must ! ” “[556-you] [I]0-i give it up . ” [Mary]85-mary refused to let [me]556-you give it up . [She]85-mary helped [me]556-you by another hint . “[556-you] What did [you]556-you once say [you]556-you wished [you]556-you had in [[your]556-you boat]557-your boat ? ” [she]85-mary asked . “[556-you] Was it long ago ? ” [I]556-you inquired , at a loss for an answer . “[556-you] Long , long ago ! Before the winter . When the autumn leaves were falling , and [you]0-i took [me]0-i out one evening for a sail . Ah , [George]74-mr. germaine , [you]74-mr. germaine have forgotten ! ” Too true , of [me]74-mr. germaine and of [[my]74-mr. germaine brethren]2305-my brethren , old and young alike ! It is always [his]74-mr. germaine love that forgets , and [her]85-mary love that remembers . [We]2306-we were [only two children]2307-only two children , and [we]2306-we were types of [the man]2308-the man and [the woman]2309-the woman already . [Mary]85-mary lost patience with [me]74-mr. germaine . Forgetting the terrible presence of [[her]85-mary grandmother]2301-her grandmother , [she]85-mary jumped up , and snatched the concealed object out of [her]85-mary handkerchief . “[74-mr. germaine] There ! ” [she]85-mary cried , briskly , “[74-mr. germaine] now do [you]74-mr. germaine know what it is ? ” [I]85-mary remembered at last . The thing [I]85-mary had wished for in [[my]85-mary boat]392-my boat , all those months ago , was a new flag . And here was the flag , made for [me]85-mary in secret by [Mary]85-mary ’s own hand ! The ground was green silk , with a dove embroidered on it in white , carrying in its beak the typical olive - branch , wrought in gold thread . The work was the tremulous , uncertain work of [a child]2312-a child ’s fingers . But how faithfully [[my]85-mary little darling]2313-my little darling had remembered [my]85-mary wish ! how patiently [she]2313-my little darling had plied the needle over the traced lines of the pattern ! how industriously [she]2313-my little darling had labored through the dreary winter days ! and all for [my]85-mary sake ! What words could tell [my]85-mary pride , [my]85-mary gratitude , [my]85-mary happiness ? [I]85-mary too forgot the presence of [the Sibyl]92-the sibyl bending over [her]92-the sibyl book . [I]85-mary took [the little workwoman]2314-the little workwoman in [my]85-mary arms , and kissed [her]2314-the little workwoman till [I]85-mary was fairly out of breath and could kiss no longer . “[85-mary] [Mary]85-mary ! ” [I]85-mary burst out , in the first heat of [my]85-mary enthusiasm , “[85-mary] [[my]0-i father]315-my father is coming [home]2233-home to - day . [I]0-i will speak to [him]315-my father to - night . And [I]0-i will marry [you]85-mary to - morrow ! ” “[0-i] [Boy]2251-boy ! ” said the awful voice at the other end of [the room]185-the room . “[2251-boy] Come here . ” [Dame Dermody]88-dame dermody ’s mystic book was closed ; [Dame Dermody]88-dame dermody ’s weird black eyes were watching [us]2316-us in [our]2316-us corner . [I]2251-boy approached [her]2314-the little workwoman ; and [Mary]85-mary followed [me]2251-boy timidly , by a footstep at a time . [The Sibyl]92-the sibyl took [me]2251-boy by the hand , with a caressing gentleness which was new in [my]2251-boy experience of [her]92-the sibyl . “[2251-boy] Do [you]0-i prize that toy ? ” [she]92-the sibyl inquired , looking at the flag . “[0-i] Hide it ! ” [she]92-the sibyl cried , before [I]0-i could answer . “[0-i] Hide it — or it may be taken from [you]0-i ! ” “[0-i] Why should [I]0-i hide it ? ” [I]0-i asked . “[0-i] [I]0-i want to fly it at the mast of [[my]0-i boat]392-my boat . ” “[0-i] [You]0-i will never fly it at the mast of [[your]0-i boat]557-your boat ! ” With that answer [she]92-the sibyl took the flag from [me]0-i and thrust it impatiently into the breast - pocket of [my]0-i jacket . “[0-i] Do n’t crumple it , [grandmother]563-grandmother ! ” said [Mary]85-mary , piteously . [I]563-grandmother repeated [my]563-grandmother question : “[563-grandmother] Why shall [I]0-i never fly it at the mast of [[my]0-i boat]392-my boat ? ” [Dame Dermody]88-dame dermody laid [her]0-i hand on the closed volume of [Swedenborg]90-emanuel swedenborg lying in [her]0-i lap . “[565-the prophet] Three times [I]0-i have opened this book since the morning , ” [she]0-i said . “[0-i] Three times the words of [the prophet]565-the prophet warn [me]0-i that there is trouble coming . [Children]357-children , it is trouble that is coming to [You]357-children . [I]0-i look there , ” [she]0-i went on , pointing to the place where a ray of sunlight poured slanting into [the room]185-the room , “[0-i] and [I]0-i see [[my]0-i husband]2225-my husband in the heavenly light . [He]2225-my husband bows [his]2225-my husband head in grief , and [he]2225-my husband points [his]2225-my husband unerring hand at [You]357-children . [George]74-mr. germaine and [Mary]85-mary , [you]357-children are consecrated to [each other]354-each other ! Be always worthy of [your]357-children consecration ; be always worthy of [yourselves]357-children . ” [She]0-i paused . [Her]0-i voice faltered . [She]0-i looked at [us]2318-us with softening eyes , as [those look who know sadly that there is a parting at hand]2319-those look who know sadly that there is a parting at hand . “[2225-my husband] Kneel ! ” [she]0-i said , in low tones of awe and grief . “[2225-my husband] It may be the last time [I]0-i bless [you]357-children — it may be the last time [I]0-i pray over [you]357-children , in [this house]569-this house . Kneel ! ” [We]2318-us knelt close together at [her]0-i feet . [I]570-god could feel [Mary]85-mary ’s heart throbbing , as [she]85-mary pressed nearer and nearer to [my]570-god side . [I]570-god could feel [my]570-god own heart quickening its beat , with a fear that was a mystery to [me]570-god . “[570-god] God bless and keep [George]74-mr. germaine and [Mary]85-mary , here and hereafter ! [God]570-god prosper , in future days , the union which [God]93-god ’s wisdom has willed ! Amen . So be it . Amen . ” As the last words fell from [her]0-i lips the cottage door was thrust open . [[My]88-dame dermody father]315-my father — followed by [the bailiff]320-the bailiff — entered [the room]185-the room . [Dame Dermody]88-dame dermody got slowly on [her]88-dame dermody feet , and looked at [him]320-the bailiff with a stern scrutiny . “[88-dame dermody] It has come , ” [she]88-dame dermody said to [herself]88-dame dermody . “[571-it] [It]571-it looks with the eyes — it will speak with the voice — of [that man]572-that man . ” [[My]573-my father]315-my father broke the silence that followed , addressing [himself]315-my father to [the bailiff]320-the bailiff . “[573-my] [You]573-my see , [Dermody]88-dame dermody , ” [he]320-the bailiff said , “[88-dame dermody] here is [[my]0-i son]574-my son in [[your]88-dame dermody cottage]575-your cottage — when [he]574-my son ought to be in [[my]0-i house]576-my house . ” [He]320-the bailiff turned , and looked at [me]74-mr. germaine as [I]74-mr. germaine stood with [my]74-mr. germaine arm round [little Mary]85-mary , patiently waiting for [my]74-mr. germaine opportunity to speak . “[74-mr. germaine] [George]74-mr. germaine , ” [he]320-the bailiff said , with the hard smile which was peculiar to [him]320-the bailiff , when [he]320-the bailiff was angry and was trying to hide it , “[74-mr. germaine] [you]74-mr. germaine are making a fool of [yourself]74-mr. germaine there . Leave [that child]577-that child , and come to [me]0-i . ” Now , or never , was [my]99-papa time to declare [myself]99-papa . Judging by appearances , [I]99-papa was still [a boy]2242-a boy . Judging by [my]99-papa own sensations , [I]99-papa had developed into [a man]2326-a man at a moment ’s notice . “[99-papa] [Papa]99-papa , ” [I]99-papa said , “[99-papa] [I]0-i am glad to see [you]99-papa [home]2233-home again . This is [Mary Dermody]85-mary . [I]0-i am in love with [her]85-mary , and [she]85-mary is in love with [me]0-i . [I]0-i wish to marry [her]85-mary as soon as it is convenient to [[my]0-i mother]365-my mother and [you]99-papa . ” [[My]0-i father]315-my father burst out laughing . Before [I]0-i could speak again , [his]315-my father humor changed . [He]315-my father had observed that [Dermody]85-mary , too , presumed to be amused . [He]315-my father seemed to become mad with anger , all in a moment . “[0-i] [I]0-i have been told of this infernal tomfoolery , ” [he]315-my father said , “[0-i] but [I]0-i did n’t believe it till now . Who has turned [the boy]580-the boy ’s weak head ? Who has encouraged [him]580-the boy to stand there hugging [that girl]581-that girl ? If it ’s [you]99-papa , [Dermody]85-mary , it shall be the worst day ’s work [you]99-papa ever did in [your]99-papa life . ” [He]315-my father turned to [me]0-i again , before [the bailiff]320-the bailiff could defend [himself]315-my father . “[0-i] Do [you]99-papa hear what [I]0-i say ? [I]0-i tell [you]99-papa to leave [[Dermody]85-mary ’s girl]582-dermody ’s girl , and come [home]2233-home with [me]0-i . ” “[0-i] Yes , [papa]584-papa , ” [I]584-papa answered . “[584-papa] But [I]0-i must go back to [Mary]85-mary , if [you]584-papa please , after [I]0-i have been with [you]584-papa . ” Angry as [he]584-papa was , [[my]99-papa father]315-my father was positively staggered by [my]99-papa audacity . “[99-papa] [[You]99-papa young idiot]585-you young idiot , [your]99-papa insolence exceeds belief ! ” [he]584-papa burst out . “[0-i] [I]0-i tell [you]99-papa this : [you]99-papa will never darken these doors again ! [You]99-papa have been taught to disobey [me]0-i [here]586-here . [You]99-papa have had things put into [your]99-papa head , here , which [[no boy]587-no boy of [your]99-papa age]588-no boy of your age ought to know — [I’ll]0-i say more , which [no decent people]589-no decent people would have let [you]99-papa know . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i beg [your]0-i pardon , [sir]2230-sir , ” [Dermody]85-mary interposed , very respectfully and very firmly at the same time . “[0-i] There are many things which [a master in a hot temper]591-a master in a hot temper is privileged to say to [the man who serves [him]591-a master in a hot temper]592-the man who serves him . But [you]99-papa have gone beyond [your]99-papa privilege . [You]99-papa have shamed [me]0-i , [sir]2230-sir , in the presence of [[my]0-i mother]365-my mother , in the hearing of [[my]0-i child]282-my child — ” [[My]99-papa father]315-my father checked [him]99-papa there . “[99-papa] [You]99-papa may spare the rest of it , ” [he]315-my father said . “[596-we] [We]596-we are [master]597-master and [servant]598-servant no longer . When [[my]0-i son]574-my son came hanging about [[your]99-papa cottage]575-your cottage , and playing at sweethearts with [[your]99-papa girl]601-your girl there , [your]99-papa duty was to close the door on [him]574-my son . [You]99-papa have failed in [your]99-papa duty . [I]0-i trust [you]99-papa no longer . Take a month ’s notice , [Dermody]85-mary . [You]99-papa leave [my]0-i service . ” [The bailiff]320-the bailiff steadily met [[my]0-i father]315-my father on [his]320-the bailiff ground . [He]320-the bailiff was no longer [the easy , sweet - tempered , modest man who was [the man of [my]0-i remembrance]2334-the man of my remembrance]2333-the easy , sweet - tempered , modest man who was the man of my remembrance . “[0-i] [I]0-i beg to decline taking [your]99-papa month ’s notice , [sir]2230-sir , ” [he]320-the bailiff answered . “[2230-sir] [You]99-papa shall have no opportunity of repeating what [you]99-papa have just said to [me]0-i . [I]0-i will send in [my]0-i accounts to - night . And [I]0-i will leave [your]99-papa service to - morrow . ” “[0-i] [We]603-we agree for once , ” retorted [[my]603-we father]315-my father . “[603-we] The sooner [you]99-papa go , the better . ” [He]315-my father stepped across [the room]185-the room and put [his]315-my father hand on [my]0-i shoulder . “[0-i] Listen to [me]0-i , ” [he]315-my father said , making a last effort to control [himself]315-my father . “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t want to quarrel with [you]99-papa before [a discarded servant]604-a discarded servant . There must be an end to this nonsense . Leave [these people]605-these people to pack up and go , and come back to [the house]258-the house with [me]0-i . ” [His]315-my father heavy hand , pressing on [my]584-papa shoulder , seemed to press the spirit of resistance out of [me]584-papa . [I]584-papa so far gave way as to try to melt [him]315-my father by entreaties . “[584-papa] Oh , [papa]584-papa ! [papa]584-papa ! ” [I]584-papa cried . “[584-papa] Do n’t part [me]0-i from [Mary]85-mary ! See how pretty and good [she]85-mary is ! [She]85-mary has made [me]0-i a flag for [[my]0-i boat]392-my boat . Let [me]0-i come here and see [her]85-mary sometimes . [I]0-i ca n’t live without [her]85-mary . ” [I]0-i could say no more . [[My]0-i poor little [Mary]85-mary]2337-my poor little mary burst out crying . [Her]85-mary tears and [my]0-i entreaties were alike wasted on [[my]0-i father]315-my father . “[0-i] Take [your]610-your choice , ” [he]315-my father said , “[610-your] between coming away of [your]610-your own accord , or obliging [me]0-i to take [you]610-your away by force . [I]0-i mean to part [you]610-your and [[Dermody]85-mary ’s girl]582-dermody ’s girl . ” “[0-i] Neither [you]610-your nor [any man]612-any man can part [them]613-them , ” interposed a voice , speaking behind [us]2339-us . “[610-your] Rid [your]610-your mind of that notion , [master]597-master , before it is too late . ” [[My]0-i father]315-my father looked round quickly , and discovered [Dame Dermody]88-dame dermody facing [him]315-my father in the full light of the window . [She]582-dermody ’s girl had stepped back , at the outset of the dispute , into the corner behind the fireplace . There [she]582-dermody ’s girl had remained , biding [her]582-dermody ’s girl time to speak , until [[my]0-i father]315-my father ’s last threat brought [her]582-dermody ’s girl out of [her]582-dermody ’s girl place of retirement . [They]613-them looked at [each other]354-each other for a moment . [[My]0-i father]315-my father seemed to think it beneath [his]315-my father dignity to answer [her]582-dermody ’s girl . [He]315-my father went on with what [he]315-my father had to say to [me]0-i . “[0-i] [I]0-i shall count three slowly , ” [he]315-my father resumed . “[0-i] Before [I]0-i get to the last number , make up [your]615-my mind to do what [I]0-i tell [you]615-my , or submit to the disgrace of being taken away by force . ” “[0-i] Take [him]616-his where [you]615-my may , ” said [Dame Dermody]88-dame dermody , “[0-i] [he]616-his will still be on [his]616-his way to [his]616-his marriage with [[my]0-i grandchild]2260-my grandchild . ” “[616-his] And where shall [I]0-i be , if [you]0-i please ? ” asked [[my]615-my father]315-my father , stung into speaking to [her]0-i this time . The answer followed instantly in these startling words : “[615-my] [You]615-my will be on [your]615-my way to [your]615-my ruin and [your]615-my death . ” [[My]615-my father]315-my father turned [his]315-my father back on [the prophetess]2346-the prophetess with a smile of contempt . “[615-my] One ! ” [he]315-my father said , beginning to count . [I]615-my set [my]615-my teeth , and clasped both arms round [Mary]85-mary as [he]315-my father spoke . [I]615-my had inherited some of [his]315-my father temper , and [he]315-my father was now to know it . “[615-my] Two ! ” proceeded [[my]615-my father]315-my father , after waiting a little . [Mary]85-mary put [her]85-mary trembling lips to [my]615-my ear , and whispered : “[615-my] Let [me]0-i go , [George]74-mr. germaine ! [I]0-i ca n’t bear to see it . Oh , look how [he]74-mr. germaine frowns ! [I]0-i know [he]74-mr. germaine ’ll hurt [you]618-you . ” [[My]74-mr. germaine father]315-my father lifted [his]315-my father forefinger as a preliminary warning before [he]315-my father counted Three . “[74-mr. germaine] Stop ! ” cried [Dame Dermody]88-dame dermody . [[My]74-mr. germaine father]315-my father looked round at [her]88-dame dermody again with sardonic astonishment . “[74-mr. germaine] [I]0-i beg [your]618-you pardon , [ma’am]2244-ma’am — have [you]618-you anything particular to say to [me]0-i ? ” [he]315-my father asked . “[178-man] [Man]178-man ! ” returned [the Sibyl]92-the sibyl , “[178-man] [you]178-man speak lightly . Have [I]0-i spoken lightly to [You]178-man ? [I]0-i warn [you]178-man to bow [your]178-man wicked will before a Will that is mightier than [yours]178-man . [The spirits of [these children]622-these children]621-the spirits of these children are [kindred spirits]623-kindred spirits . For time and for eternity [they]621-the spirits of these children are united one to the other . Put [land]624-land and [sea]625-sea between [them]621-the spirits of these children — [they]621-the spirits of these children will still be together ; [they]621-the spirits of these children will communicate in visions , [they]621-the spirits of these children will be revealed to [each other]354-each other in dreams . Bind [them]621-the spirits of these children by worldly ties ; [we]627-we d [[your]178-man son]2257-your son , in the time to come , to [another woman]629-another woman , and [[my]0-i grand - daughter]630-my grand - daughter to [another man]631-another man . In vain ! [I]0-i tell [you]178-man , in vain ! [You]178-man may doom [them]621-the spirits of these children to misery , [you]178-man may drive [them]621-the spirits of these children to sin — the day of [their]621-the spirits of these children union on [earth]496-earth is still a day predestined in [heaven]2261-heaven . It will come ! it will come ! Submit , while the time for submission is [yours]178-man . [You]178-man are [a doomed man]634-a doomed man . [I]0-i see the shadow of disaster , [I]0-i see the seal of death , on [your]178-man face . Go ; and leave [these consecrated ones]635-these consecrated ones to walk the dark ways of [the world]287-the world together , in the strength of [their]635-these consecrated ones innocence , in the light of [their]635-these consecrated ones love . Go — and [God]93-god forgive [you]178-man ! ” In spite of [himself]0-i , [[my]74-mr. germaine father]315-my father was struck by the irresistible strength of conviction which inspired those words .
