[[The bailiff]320-the bailiff ’s mother]456-the bailiff ’s mother had impressed [him]315-my father as [a tragic actress]2353-a tragic actress might have impressed [him]315-my father on the stage . [She]456-the bailiff ’s mother had checked the mocking answer on [his]315-my father lips , but [she]456-the bailiff ’s mother had not shaken [his]315-my father iron will . [His]315-my father face was as hard as ever when [he]315-my father turned [my]74-mr. germaine way once more . “[74-mr. germaine] The last chance , [George]74-mr. germaine , ” [he]315-my father said , and counted the last number : “[74-mr. germaine] Three ! ” [I]74-mr. germaine neither moved nor answered [him]315-my father . “[74-mr. germaine] [You]74-mr. germaine will have it ? ” [he]315-my father said , as [he]315-my father fastened [his]315-my father hold on [my]74-mr. germaine arm . [I]74-mr. germaine fastened [my]74-mr. germaine hold on [Mary]85-mary ; [I]74-mr. germaine whispered to [her]85-mary , “[74-mr. germaine] [I]0-i wo n’t leave [you]74-mr. germaine ! ” [She]85-mary seemed not to hear [me]74-mr. germaine . [She]85-mary trembled from head to foot in [my]74-mr. germaine arms . A faint cry of terror fluttered from [her]85-mary lips . [Dermody]85-mary instantly stepped forward . Before [[my]74-mr. germaine father]315-my father could wrench [me]74-mr. germaine away from [her]85-mary , [he]315-my father had said in [my]74-mr. germaine ear , “[74-mr. germaine] [You]0-i can give [her]637-her to [me]0-i , [Master George]74-mr. germaine , ” and had released [[his]315-my father child]2355-his child from [my]74-mr. germaine embrace . [She]85-mary stretched [her]85-mary little frail hands out yearningly to [me]74-mr. germaine , as [she]85-mary lay in [Dermody]85-mary ’s arms . “[74-mr. germaine] Good - by , [dear]638-dear , ” [she]85-mary said , faintly . [I]638-dear saw [her]85-mary head sink on [[her]85-mary father]390-her father ’s bosom as [I]638-dear was dragged to the door . In [my]638-dear helpless rage and misery , [I]638-dear struggled against the cruel hands that had got [me]638-dear with all the strength [I]638-dear had left . [I]638-dear cried out to [her]639-my , “[638-dear] [I]0-i love [you]639-my , [Mary]85-mary ! [I]0-i will come back to [you]639-my , [Mary]85-mary ! [I]0-i will never marry [any one]640-any one but [you]639-my ! ” Step by step , [I]639-my was forced further and further away . The last [I]639-my saw of [her]639-my , [[my]639-my darling]2357-my darling ’s head was still resting on [Dermody]85-mary ’s breast . [[Her]2357-my darling grandmother]2301-her grandmother stood near , and shook [her]2301-her grandmother withered hands at [[my]639-my father]315-my father , and shrieked [her]2301-her grandmother terrible prophecy , in the hysteric frenzy that possessed [her]2301-her grandmother when [she]2301-her grandmother saw the separation accomplished . “[639-my] Go!—you go to [your]639-my ruin ! [you]639-my go to [your]639-my death ! ” While [her]2301-her grandmother voice still rang in [my]639-my ears , the cottage door was opened and closed again . It was all over . The modest world of [my]639-my boyish love and [my]639-my boyish joy disappeared like the vision of a dream . [The empty outer wilderness]2360-the empty outer wilderness , which was [[[my]639-my father]315-my father ’s world]2362-my father ’s world , opened before [me]639-my void of love and void of joy . [God]93-god forgive [me]639-my — how [I]639-my hated [him]315-my father at that moment ! FOR the rest of the day , and through the night , [I]639-my was kept a close prisoner in [[my]639-my room]2363-my room , watched by [a man on whose fidelity [[my]639-my father]315-my father could depend]2364-a man on whose fidelity my father could depend . The next morning [I]639-my made an effort to escape , and was discovered before [I]639-my had got free of [the house]258-the house . Confined again to [[my]639-my room]2363-my room , [I]639-my contrived to write to [Mary]85-mary , and to slip [my]639-my note into the willing hand of [the housemaid who attended on [me]639-my]2368-the housemaid who attended on me . Useless ! The vigilance of [[my]639-my guardian]2369-my guardian was not to be evaded . [The woman]2309-the woman was suspected and followed , and the letter was taken from [her]2309-the woman . [[My]639-my father]315-my father tore it up with [his]315-my father own hands . Later in the day , [[my]639-my mother]365-my mother was permitted to see [me]639-my . [She]365-my mother was quite unfit , poor soul , to intercede for [me]639-my , or to serve [my]639-my interests in any way . [[My]639-my father]315-my father had completely overwhelmed [her]365-my mother by announcing that [[his]315-my father wife]215-his wife and [[his]315-my father son]2236-his son were to accompany [him]315-my father , when [he]315-my father returned to [America]3-america . “[639-my] Every farthing [he]641-his has in [the world]287-the world , ” said [[my]641-his mother]365-my mother , “[641-his] is to be thrown into that hateful speculation . [He]641-his has raised money in [London]2-london ; [he]641-his has let [the house]258-the house to [some rich tradesman]644-some rich tradesman for seven years ; [he]641-his has sold the plate , and the jewels that came to [me]0-i from [[his]641-his mother]645-his mother . [The land in [America]3-america]646-the land in america swallows it all up . [We]647-we have [no home]648-no home , [George]74-mr. germaine , and no choice but to go with [him]641-his . ” An hour afterward the post - chaise was at the door . [[My]649-me father]315-my father [himself]315-my father took [me]649-me to [the carriage]2378-the carriage . [I]649-me broke away from [him]315-my father , with a desperation which not even [his]315-my father resolution could resist . [I]649-me ran , [I]649-me flew , along the path that led to [[Dermody]85-mary ’s cottage]2379-dermody ’s cottage . The door stood open ; [the parlor]2380-the parlor was empty . [I]649-me went into [the kitchen]2381-the kitchen ; [I]649-me went into [the upper rooms]2382-the upper rooms . Solitude everywhere . [The bailiff]320-the bailiff had left [the place]2384-the place ; and [[his]641-his mother]645-his mother and [[his]641-his daughter]437-his daughter had gone with [him]641-his . [No friend]2387-no friend or [neighbor]2388-neighbor lingered near with a message ; no letter lay waiting for [me]649-me ; no hint was left to tell [me]649-me in what direction [they]2389-they had taken [their]2389-they departure . After the insulting words which [[his]641-his master]2390-his master had spoken to [him]641-his , [Dermody]85-mary ’s pride was concerned in leaving no trace of [his]641-his whereabouts ; [[my]649-me father]315-my father might consider it as a trace purposely left with the object of reuniting [Mary]85-mary and [me]649-me . [I]649-me had no keepsake to speak to [me]649-me of [[my]649-me lost darling]2392-my lost darling but the flag which [she]2392-my lost darling had embroidered with [her]2392-my lost darling own hand . The furniture still remained in [the cottage]363-the cottage . [I]649-me sat down in [[our]649-me customary corner]2394-our customary corner , by [Mary]85-mary ’s empty chair , and looked again at the pretty green flag , and burst out crying . A light touch roused [me]649-me . [[My]649-me father]315-my father had so far yielded as to leave to [[my]649-me mother]365-my mother the responsibility of bringing [me]649-me back to [the traveling carriage]2397-the traveling carriage . “[649-me] [We]649-me shall not find [Mary]85-mary here , [George]74-mr. germaine , ” [she]365-my mother said , gently . “[74-mr. germaine] And [we]649-me may hear of [her]85-mary in [London]2-london . Come with [me]0-i . ” [I]0-i rose and silently gave [her]365-my mother [my]0-i hand . Something low down on the clean white door - post caught [my]0-i eye as [we]649-me passed it . [I]0-i stooped , and discovered some writing in pencil . [I]0-i looked closer — it was writing in [Mary]85-mary ’s hand ! The unformed childish characters traced these last words of farewell : “[0-i] Good - by , [dear]638-dear . Do n’t forget [Mary]85-mary . ” [I]86-trim knelt down and kissed the writing . It comforted [me]86-trim — it was like a farewell touch from [Mary]85-mary ’s hand . [I]86-trim followed [[my]86-trim mother]365-my mother quietly to [the carriage]2378-the carriage . Late that night [we]649-me were in [London]2-london . [[My]86-trim good mother]2400-my good mother did all that the most compassionate kindness could do ( in [her]2400-my good mother position ) to comfort [me]86-trim . [She]2400-my good mother privately wrote to [the solicitors employed by [[her]2400-my good mother family]475-her family]2401-the solicitors employed by her family , inclosing a description of [Dermody]85-mary and [[his]2403-his mother]645-his mother and [daughter]2405-daughter and directing inquiries to be made at [the various coach - offices in [London]2-london]2406-the various coach - offices in london . [She]2400-my good mother also referred [the lawyers]2407-the lawyers to [two of [[Dermody]85-mary ’s relatives]2409-dermody ’s relatives , who lived in [the city]2410-the city , and who might know something of [his]2403-his movements after [he]2403-his left [[my]86-trim father]315-my father ’s service]2408-two of dermody ’s relatives , who lived in the city , and who might know something of his movements after he left my father ’s service . When [she]2400-my good mother had done this , [she]2400-my good mother had done all that lay in [her]2400-my good mother power . [We]2412-we neither of [us]2412-we possessed money enough to advertise in the newspapers . A week afterward [we]2412-we sailed for [the United States]8-the united states . Twice in that interval [I]86-trim communicated with [the lawyers]2407-the lawyers ; and twice [I]86-trim was informed that the inquiries had led to nothing . With this the first epoch in [my]86-trim love story comes to an end . For ten long years afterward [I]86-trim never again met with [[my]86-trim little [Mary]85-mary]299-my little mary ; [I]86-trim never even heard whether [she]85-mary had lived to grow to womanhood or not . [I]86-trim still kept the green flag , with the dove worked on it . For the rest , [the waters of oblivion]2415-the waters of oblivion had closed over the old golden days at [Greenwater Broad]5-greenwater broad . WHEN [YOU]2416-you last saw [me]86-trim , [I]86-trim was [a boy of thirteen]2417-a boy of thirteen . [You]2416-you now see [me]86-trim [a man of twenty - three]2418-a man of twenty - three . The story of [my]86-trim life , in the interval between these two ages , is a story that can be soon told . Speaking of [[my]86-trim father]315-my father first , [I]86-trim have to record that the end of [his]315-my father career did indeed come as [Dame Dermody]88-dame dermody had foretold it . Before [we]2420-we had been a year in [America]3-america , the total collapse of [his]315-my father land speculation was followed by [his]315-my father death . The catastrophe was complete . But for [[my]86-trim mother]365-my mother ’s little income ( settled on [her]365-my mother at [her]365-my mother marriage ) [we]2420-we should both have been left helpless at the mercy of [the world]287-the world . [We]2420-we made [some kind friends]2423-some kind friends among [the hearty and hospitable people of [the United States]145-the united states , whom [we]2420-we were unaffectedly sorry to leave]2424-the hearty and hospitable people of the united states , whom we were unaffectedly sorry to leave . But there were reasons which inclined [us]2420-we to return to [[our]2420-we own country]171-our own country after [[my]86-trim father]315-my father ’s death ; and [we]2420-we did return accordingly . Besides [[her]365-my mother brother - in - law]2428-her brother - in - law ( already mentioned in the earlier pages of [my]86-trim narrative ) , [[my]86-trim mother]365-my mother had [another relative]2430-another relative — [a cousin named [Germaine]74-mr. germaine]2431-a cousin named germaine — on whose assistance [she]365-my mother mainly relied for starting [me]86-trim , when the time came , in a professional career . [I]86-trim remember it as a family rumor , that [Mr. Germaine]74-mr. germaine had been [an unsuccessful suitor for [[my]86-trim mother]365-my mother ’s hand in the days when [they]2434-they were [young people together]2435-young people together]2432-an unsuccessful suitor for my mother ’s hand in the days when they were young people together . [He]74-mr. germaine was still [a bachelor]2436-a bachelor at the later period when [[his]74-mr. germaine eldest brother]2437-his eldest brother ’s death without issue placed [him]74-mr. germaine in possession of a handsome fortune . The accession of wealth made no difference in [his]74-mr. germaine habits of life : [he]74-mr. germaine was [a lonely old man , estranged from [[his]74-mr. germaine other relatives]2439-his other relatives , when [[my]86-trim mother]365-my mother and [I]86-trim returned to [England]1-england]2438-a lonely old man , estranged from his other relatives , when my mother and i returned to england . If [I]86-trim could only succeed in pleasing [Mr. Germaine]74-mr. germaine , [I]86-trim might consider [my]86-trim prospects ( in some degree , at least ) as being prospects assured . This was one consideration that influenced [us]2434-they in leaving [America]3-america . There was another — in which [I]86-trim was especially interested — that drew [me]86-trim back to [the lonely shores of [Greenwater Broad]5-greenwater broad]2441-the lonely shores of greenwater broad . [My]86-trim only hope of recovering a trace of [Mary]85-mary was to make inquiries among the cottagers in [the neighborhood of [[my]86-trim old home]2443-my old home]2442-the neighborhood of my old home . [The good bailiff]362-the good bailiff had been heartily liked and respected in [[his]362-the good bailiff little sphere]2445-his little sphere . It seemed at least possible that [some among [[his]362-the good bailiff many friends in [Suffolk]6-suffolk]2447-his many friends in suffolk]2446-some among his many friends in suffolk might have discovered traces of [him]362-the good bailiff , in the year that had passed since [I]86-trim had left [England]1-england . In [my]86-trim dreams of [Mary]85-mary — and [I]86-trim dreamed of [her]85-mary constantly — [the lake]289-the lake and [its]289-the lake woody banks formed a frequent background in the visionary picture of [[my]86-trim lost companion]2449-my lost companion . To [the lake shores]2450-the lake shores [I]86-trim looked , with a natural superstition , as to [my]86-trim way back to the one life that had its promise of happiness for [me]86-trim — [my]86-trim life with [Mary]85-mary . On [our]2451-our arrival in [London]2-london , [I]86-trim started for [Suffolk]6-suffolk alone — at [[my]86-trim mother]365-my mother ’s request . At [her]85-mary age [she]85-mary naturally shrank from revisiting the home scenes now occupied by [the strangers to whom [[our]2451-our house had been let]2454-our house had been let]2453-the strangers to whom our house had been let . Ah , how [my]86-trim heart ached ( young as [I]86-trim was ) when [I]86-trim saw [the familiar green waters of [the lake]289-the lake]2455-the familiar green waters of the lake once more ! It was evening . The first object that caught [my]86-trim eye was [the gayly painted boat , once mine , in which [Mary]85-mary and [I]86-trim had so often sailed together]2457-the gayly painted boat , once mine , in which mary and i had so often sailed together . [The people in possession of [[our]2451-our house]2459-our house]2458-the people in possession of our house were sailing now . The sound of [their]2458-the people in possession of our house laughter floated toward [me]86-trim merrily over [the still water]2460-the still water . [Their]2458-the people in possession of our house flag flew at the little mast - head , from which [Mary]85-mary ’s flag had never fluttered in the pleasant breeze . [I]86-trim turned [my]86-trim eyes from [the boat]2461-the boat ; it hurt [me]86-trim to look at it . A few steps onward brought [me]86-trim to [a promontory on [the shore]2463-the shore]2462-a promontory on the shore , and revealed the brown archways of the decoy on the opposite bank . There was the paling behind which [we]2451-our had knelt to watch the snaring of the ducks ; there was the hole through which “[86-trim] [Trim]86-trim , ” [the terrier]341-the terrier , had shown [himself]341-the terrier to rouse the stupid curiosity of the water - fowl ; there , seen at intervals through the trees , was the winding woodland path along which [Mary]85-mary and [I]86-trim had traced [our]2451-our way to [[Dermody]85-mary ’s cottage]2379-dermody ’s cottage on the day when [[my]86-trim father]315-my father ’s cruel hand had torn [us]2451-our from [each other]354-each other . How wisely [[my]86-trim good mother]2400-my good mother had shrunk from looking again at the dear old scenes ! [I]86-trim turned [my]86-trim back on [the lake]289-the lake , to think with calmer thoughts in the shadowy solitude of [the woods]391-the woods . An hour ’s walk along [the winding banks]2471-the winding banks brought [me]86-trim round to [the cottage which had once been [Mary]85-mary ’s home]2472-the cottage which had once been mary ’s home . The door was opened by [a woman who was [a stranger to [me]86-trim]2474-a stranger to me]2473-a woman who was a stranger to me . [She]2473-a woman who was a stranger to me civilly asked [me]86-trim to enter [the parlor]2380-the parlor . [I]86-trim had suffered enough already ; [I]86-trim made [my]86-trim inquiries , standing on the doorstep . [They]2476-they were soon at an end . [The woman]2309-the woman was [a stranger in [[our]2479-our part of [Suffolk]6-suffolk]467-our part of suffolk]2478-a stranger in our part of suffolk ; neither [she]2309-the woman nor [[her]2309-the woman husband]206-her husband had ever heard of [Dermody]85-mary ’s name . [I]86-trim pursued [my]86-trim investigations among [the peasantry]2482-the peasantry , passing from [cottage]2483-cottage to [cottage]2483-cottage . The twilight came ; the moon rose ; the lights began to vanish from the lattice - windows ; and still [I]86-trim continued [my]86-trim weary pilgrimage ; and still , go where [I]86-trim might , the answer to [my]86-trim questions was the same . [Nobody]2485-nobody knew anything of [Dermody]85-mary . [Everybody]2486-everybody asked if [I]86-trim had not brought news of [him]206-her husband [myself]86-trim . It pains [me]86-trim even now to recall the cruelly complete defeat of every effort which [I]86-trim made on that disastrous evening . [I]86-trim passed the night in [one of [the cottages]2488-the cottages]2487-one of the cottages ; and [I]86-trim returned to [London]2-london the next day , broken by disappointment , careless what [I]86-trim did , or where [I]86-trim went next . Still , [we]2489-our were not wholly parted . [I]86-trim saw [Mary]85-mary — as [Dame Dermody]88-dame dermody said [I]86-trim should see [her]85-mary — in dreams . Sometimes [she]85-mary came to [me]86-trim with the green flag in [her]85-mary hand , and repeated [her]85-mary farewell words—“Don’t[86-trim] forget [Mary]85-mary ! ” Sometimes [she]85-mary led [me]651-we to [[our]2489-our well - remembered corner in [the cottage parlor]2491-the cottage parlor]2490-our well - remembered corner in the cottage parlor , and opened the paper on which [[her]85-mary grandmother]2301-her grandmother had written [our]2489-our prayers for [us]2489-our . [We]651-we prayed together again , and sung hymns together again , as if the old times had come back . Once [she]85-mary appeared to [me]651-we , with tears in [her]85-mary eyes , and said , “[651-we] [We]651-we must wait , [dear]638-dear : [our]651-we time has not come yet . ” Twice [I]651-we saw [her]85-mary looking at [me]651-we , like [one disturbed by anxious thoughts]2493-one disturbed by anxious thoughts ; and twice [I]651-we heard [her]85-mary say , “[651-we] Live patiently , live innocently , [George]74-mr. germaine , for [my]0-i sake . ” [We]651-we settled in [London]2-london , where [my]74-mr. germaine education was undertaken by [a private tutor]2494-a private tutor . Before [we]651-we had been long in [[our]651-we new abode]2495-our new abode , an unexpected change in [our]651-we prospects took place . To [[my]74-mr. germaine mother]365-my mother ’s astonishment [she]85-mary received an offer of marriage ( addressed to [her]85-mary in a letter ) from [Mr. Germaine]74-mr. germaine . “[74-mr. germaine] [I]0-i entreat [you]74-mr. germaine not to be startled by [my]0-i proposal ! ” ( [the old gentleman]2497-the old gentleman wrote ) . “[0-i] [You]74-mr. germaine can hardly have forgotten that [I]0-i was once fond of [you]74-mr. germaine , in the days when [we]653-we were both young and both poor . No return to the feelings associated with that time is possible now . At [my]0-i age , all [I]0-i ask of [you]74-mr. germaine is to be [the companion of the closing years of]654-the companion of the closing years of [my]0-i life , and to give [me]0-i something of [a father]655-a father ’s interest in promoting the future welfare of [[your]74-mr. germaine son]2257-your son . Consider this , [[my]0-i dear]657-my dear , and tell [me]0-i whether [you]74-mr. germaine will take the empty chair at [an old man]658-an old man ’s lonely fireside . ” [[My]0-i mother]365-my mother ( looking almost as confused , poor soul ! as if [she]365-my mother had become [a young girl]2499-a young girl again ) left the whole responsibility of decision on the shoulders of [[her]365-my mother son]468-her son ! [I]0-i was not long in making up [my]0-i mind . If [she]365-my mother said Yes , [she]365-my mother would accept the hand of [a man of worth and honor]2501-a man of worth and honor , who had been throughout [his]2501-a man of worth and honor whole life devoted to [her]365-my mother ; and [she]365-my mother would recover the comfort , the luxury , the social prosperity and position of which [[my]0-i father]315-my father ’s reckless course of life had deprived [her]365-my mother . Add to this , that [I]0-i liked [Mr. Germaine]74-mr. germaine , and that [Mr. Germaine]74-mr. germaine liked [me]0-i . Under these circumstances , why should [[my]0-i mother]365-my mother say No ? [She]365-my mother could produce no satisfactory answer to that question when [I]0-i put it . As the necessary consequence , [she]365-my mother became , in due course of time , [Mrs. Germaine]75-mrs. germaine . [I]0-i have only to add that , to the end of [her]365-my mother life , [[my]0-i good mother]2400-my good mother congratulated [herself]365-my mother ( in this case at least ) on having taken [[her]365-my mother son]468-her son ’s advice . The years went on , and still [Mary]85-mary and [I]0-i were parted , except in [my]0-i dreams . The years went on , until the perilous time which comes in [every man]2506-every man ’s life came in [mine]0-i . [I]0-i reached the age when the strongest of all the passions seizes on the senses , and asserts its mastery over mind and body alike . [I]0-i had hitherto passively endured the wreck of [my]0-i earliest and dearest hopes : [I]0-i had lived patiently , and lived innocently , for [Mary]85-mary ’s sake . Now [my]0-i patience left [me]0-i ; [my]0-i innocence was numbered among the lost things of the past . [My]0-i days , it is true , were still devoted to the tasks set [me]0-i by [[my]0-i tutor]2507-my tutor ; but [my]0-i nights were given , in secret , to a reckless profligacy , which ( in [my]0-i present frame of mind ) [I]0-i look back on with disgust and dismay . [I]0-i profaned [my]0-i remembrances of [Mary]85-mary in the company of [women who had reached the lowest depths of degradation]2508-women who had reached the lowest depths of degradation . [I]0-i impiously said to [myself]0-i : “[0-i] [I]0-i have hoped for [her]659-i long enough ; [I]0-i have waited for [her]659-i long enough . The one thing now to do is to enjoy [my]0-i youth and to forget [her]659-i . ” From the moment when [I]659-i dropped into this degradation , [I]659-i might sometimes think regretfully of [Mary]85-mary — at the morning time , when penitent thoughts mostly come to [us]2509-us ; but [I]659-i ceased absolutely to see [her]85-mary in [my]659-i dreams . [We]2509-us were now , in the completest sense of the word , parted . [Mary]85-mary ’s pure spirit could hold no communion with [mine]659-i ; [Mary]85-mary ’s pure spirit had left [me]659-i . It is needless to say that [I]659-i failed to keep the secret of [my]659-i depravity from the knowledge of [[my]659-i mother]365-my mother . The sight of [her]85-mary grief was the first influence that sobered [me]659-i . In some degree at least [I]659-i restrained [myself]659-i : [I]659-i made the effort to return to purer ways of life . [Mr. Germaine]74-mr. germaine , though [I]659-i had disappointed [him]74-mr. germaine , was too just [a man]2326-a man to give [me]659-i up as lost . [He]74-mr. germaine advised [me]659-i , as a means of self - reform , to make [my]659-i choice of a profession , and to absorb [myself]659-i in closer studies than any that [I]659-i had yet pursued . [I]659-i made [my]659-i peace with [this good friend]2512-this good friend and [second father]2513-second father , not only by following [his]74-mr. germaine advice , but by adopting the profession to which [he]74-mr. germaine had been [himself]74-mr. germaine attached before [he]74-mr. germaine inherited [his]74-mr. germaine fortune — the profession of medicine . [Mr. Germaine]74-mr. germaine had been [a surgeon]2514-a surgeon : [I]659-i resolved on being [a surgeon]2514-a surgeon too . Having entered , at rather an earlier age than usual , on [my]659-i new way of life , [I]659-i may at least say for [myself]659-i that [I]659-i worked hard . [I]659-i won , and kept , the interest of [the professors under whom [I]659-i studied]2516-the professors under whom i studied . On the other hand , it can not be denied that [my]659-i reformation was , morally speaking , far from being complete . [I]659-i worked ; but what [I]659-i did was done selfishly , bitterly , with a hard heart . In religion and morals [I]659-i adopted the views of [a materialist companion of [my]659-i studies]2517-a materialist companion of my studies — [a worn - out man of more than double [my]659-i age]2518-a worn - out man of more than double my age . [I]659-i believed in nothing but what [I]659-i could see , or taste , or feel . [I]659-i lost all faith in humanity . With the one exception of [[my]659-i mother]365-my mother , [I]659-i had no respect for [women]420-women . [My]659-i remembrances of [Mary]85-mary deteriorated until they became little more than a lost link of association with the past . [I]659-i still preserved the green flag as a matter of habit ; but it was no longer kept about [me]659-i ; it was left undisturbed in a drawer of [my]659-i writing - desk . Now and then a wholesome doubt , whether [my]659-i life was not utterly unworthy of [me]659-i , would rise in [my]659-i mind . But it held no long possession of [my]659-i thoughts . Despising [others]2521-others , it was in the logical order of things that [I]659-i should follow [my]659-i conclusions to [their]2521-others bitter end , and consistently despise [myself]659-i . The term of [my]659-i majority arrived . [I]659-i was twenty - one years old ; and of the illusions of [my]659-i youth not a vestige remained . Neither [[my]659-i mother]365-my mother nor [Mr. Germaine]74-mr. germaine could make any positive complaint of [my]659-i conduct . But [they]2521-others were both thoroughly uneasy about [me]659-i . After anxious consideration , [[my]659-i step - father]2523-my step - father arrived at a conclusion . [He]2523-my step - father decided that the one chance of restoring [me]659-i to [my]659-i better and brighter self was to try the stimulant of a life among [new people]2524-new people and new scenes . At the period of which [I]659-i am now writing , [the home government]2525-the home government had decided on sending a special diplomatic mission to one of [the native princes ruling over [a remote province of [our]2528-our Indian empire]2527-a remote province of our indian empire]2526-the native princes ruling over a remote province of our indian empire . In [the disturbed state of [the province]2530-the province]2529-the disturbed state of the province at that time , [the mission]2531-the mission , on [its]2531-the mission arrival in [India]9-india , was to be accompanied to [[the prince]2532-the prince ’s court]2533-the prince ’s court by an escort , including [the military]2534-the military as well as [the civil servants of the crown]2535-the civil servants of the crown . [The surgeon appointed to sail with the expedition from [England]1-england]2536-the surgeon appointed to sail with the expedition from england was [an old friend of [Mr. Germaine]74-mr. germaine ’s]2537-an old friend of mr. germaine ’s , and was in want of [an assistant on whose capacity [he]2536-the surgeon appointed to sail with the expedition from england could rely]2538-an assistant on whose capacity he could rely . Through [[my]659-i stepfather]2539-my stepfather ’s interest , the post was offered to [me]659-i . [I]659-i accepted it without hesitation . [My]659-i only pride left was the miserable pride of indifference . So long as [I]659-i pursued [my]659-i profession , the place in which [I]659-i pursued it was a matter of no importance to [my]659-i mind . It was long before [we]2540-we could persuade [[my]659-i mother]365-my mother even to contemplate the new prospect now set before [me]659-i . When [she]365-my mother did at length give way , [she]365-my mother yielded most unwillingly . [I]659-i confess [I]659-i left [her]365-my mother with the tears in [my]659-i eyes — the first [I]659-i had shed for many a long year past . The history of [our]2540-we expedition is part of the history of [British India]9-india . It has no place in this narrative . Speaking personally , [I]659-i have to record that [I]659-i was rendered incapable of performing [my]659-i professional duties in less than a week from the time when the mission reached its destination . [We]2540-we were encamped outside [the city]2410-the city ; and an attack was made on [us]2540-we , under cover of darkness , by [the fanatical natives]2543-the fanatical natives . The attempt was defeated with little difficulty , and with only a trifling loss on [our]2540-we side . [I]659-i was among the wounded , having been struck by a javelin , or spear , while [I]659-i was passing from [one tent]2544-one tent to another . Inflicted by a European weapon , [my]659-i injury would have been of no serious consequence . But the tip of the Indian spear had been poisoned . [I]659-i escaped the mortal danger of lockjaw ; but , through some peculiarity in the action of the poison on [my]659-i constitution ( which [I]659-i am quite unable to explain ) , the wound obstinately refused to heal . [I]659-i was invalided and sent to [Calcutta]11-calcutta , where the best surgical help was at [my]659-i disposal . To all appearance , the wound healed there — then broke out again . Twice this happened ; and [the medical men]2545-the medical men agreed that the best course to take would be to send [me]659-i [home]2233-home . [They]2545-the medical men calculated on the invigorating effect of the sea voyage , and , failing this , on the salutary influence of [my]659-i native air . In the Indian climate [I]659-i was pronounced incurable . Two days before [the ship]2547-the ship sailed a letter from [[my]659-i mother]365-my mother brought [me]659-i startling news . [My]659-i life to come — if [I]659-i had a life to come — had been turned into [a new channel]2549-a new channel . [Mr. Germaine]74-mr. germaine had died suddenly , of heart - disease . [His]74-mr. germaine will , bearing date at the time when [I]659-i left [England]1-england , bequeathed an income for life to [[my]659-i mother]365-my mother , and left the bulk of [[his]74-mr. germaine property]2551-his property to [me]659-i , on the one condition that [I]659-i adopted [his]74-mr. germaine name . [I]659-i accepted the condition , of course , and became [George Germaine]74-mr. germaine . Three months later , [[my]659-i mother]365-my mother and [I]659-i were restored to [each other]354-each other . Except that [I]659-i still had some trouble with [my]659-i wound , behold [me]659-i now to all appearance [one of the most enviable of existing mortals]2554-one of the most enviable of existing mortals ; promoted to the position of [a wealthy gentleman]2555-a wealthy gentleman ; [possessor of [a house in [London]2-london]2557-a house in london and of [a country - seat in [Perthshire]12-perthshire]2558-a country - seat in perthshire]2556-possessor of a house in london and of a country - seat in perthshire ; and , nevertheless , at twenty - three years of age , one of [the most miserable men]2559-the most miserable men living ! And [Mary]85-mary ? In the ten years that had now passed over , what had become of [Mary]85-mary ? [You]2560-you have heard [my]659-i story . Read the few pages that follow , and [you]2560-you will hear [hers]85-mary . WHAT [I]659-i have now to tell [you]2560-you of [Mary]85-mary is derived from information obtained at a date in [my]659-i life later by many years than any date of which [I]659-i have written yet . Be pleased to remember this . [Dermody]85-mary , [the bailiff]320-the bailiff , possessed relatives in [London]2-london , of whom [he]320-the bailiff occasionally spoke , and relatives in [Scotland]13-scotland , whom [he]320-the bailiff never mentioned . [[My]659-i father]315-my father had a strong prejudice against [the Scotch nation]2563-the scotch nation . [Dermody]85-mary knew [[his]320-the bailiff master]2390-his master well enough to be aware that the prejudice might extend to [him]320-the bailiff , if [he]320-the bailiff spoke of [[his]320-the bailiff Scotch kindred]2565-his scotch kindred . [He]320-the bailiff was [a discreet man]2566-a discreet man , and [he]320-the bailiff never mentioned [them]2565-his scotch kindred . On leaving [[my]659-i father]315-my father ’s service , [he]320-the bailiff had made [his]320-the bailiff way , partly by [land]624-land and partly by [sea]625-sea , to [Glasgow]14-glasgow — in which [city]2570-city [[his]320-the bailiff friends]2220-his friends resided . With [his]320-the bailiff character and [his]320-the bailiff experience , [Dermody]85-mary was [a man in a thousand to [any master who was lucky enough to discover [him]320-the bailiff]2573-any master who was lucky enough to discover him]2572-a man in a thousand to any master who was lucky enough to discover him . [[His]320-the bailiff friends]2220-his friends bestirred [themselves]2220-his friends . In six weeks ’ time [he]320-the bailiff was placed in charge of [a gentleman ’s estate on [the eastern coast of [Scotland]13-scotland]2576-the eastern coast of scotland]2575-a gentleman ’s estate on the eastern coast of scotland , and was comfortably established with [[his]320-the bailiff mother]645-his mother and [[his]320-the bailiff daughter]437-his daughter in [a new home]2579-a new home . The insulting language which [[my]659-i father]315-my father had addressed to [him]320-the bailiff had sunk deep in [Dermody]85-mary ’s mind . [He]320-the bailiff wrote privately to [[his]320-the bailiff relatives]2581-his relatives in [London]2-london , telling [them]2581-his relatives that [he]320-the bailiff had found a new situation which suited [him]320-the bailiff , and that [he]320-the bailiff had [his]320-the bailiff reasons for not at present mentioning [his]320-the bailiff address . In this way [he]320-the bailiff baffled the inquiries which [[[my]659-i mother]365-my mother ’s lawyers]2583-my mother ’s lawyers ( failing to discover a trace of [him]320-the bailiff in other directions ) addressed to [[his]320-the bailiff [London]2-london friends]2584-his london friends . Stung by [[his]320-the bailiff old master]2585-his old master ’s reproaches , [he]320-the bailiff sacrificed [[his]320-the bailiff daughter]437-his daughter and [he]320-the bailiff sacrificed [me]659-i — partly to [his]320-the bailiff own sense of self - respect , partly to [his]320-the bailiff conviction that the difference between [us]2587-us in rank made it [his]320-the bailiff duty to check all further intercourse before it was too late . Buried in [their]2588-their retirement in [a remote part of [Scotland]13-scotland]2589-a remote part of scotland , [the little household]2590-the little household lived , lost to [me]659-i , and lost to [the world]287-the world . In dreams , [I]659-i had seen and heard [Mary]85-mary . In dreams , [Mary]85-mary saw and heard [me]659-i . The innocent longings and wishes which filled [my]659-i heart while [I]659-i was still [a boy]2242-a boy were revealed to [her]85-mary in the mystery of sleep . [[Her]85-mary grandmother]2301-her grandmother , holding firmly to [her]2301-her grandmother faith in the predestined union between [us]2587-us , sustained [the girl]2594-the girl ’s courage and cheered [her]85-mary heart . [She]85-mary could hear [[her]85-mary father]390-her father say ( as [[my]659-i father]315-my father had said ) that [we]2587-us were parted to meet no more , and could privately think of [her]85-mary happy dreams as the sufficient promise of another future than the future which [Dermody]85-mary contemplated . So [she]85-mary still lived with [me]659-i in the spirit — and lived in hope . The first affliction that befell [the little household]2590-the little household was the death of [the grandmother]2598-the grandmother , by the exhaustion of extreme old age . In [her]85-mary last conscious moments , [she]85-mary said to [Mary]85-mary , “[659-i] Never forget that [you]660-you and [George]74-mr. germaine are spirits consecrated to [each other]354-each other . Wait — in the certain knowledge that no human power can hinder [your]660-you union in the time to come . ” While those words were still vividly present to [Mary]85-mary ’s mind , [our]2587-us visionary union by dreams was abruptly broken on [her]85-mary side , as it had been abruptly broken on [mine]659-i . In the first days of [my]659-i self - degradation , [I]659-i had ceased to see [Mary]85-mary . Exactly at the same period [Mary]85-mary ceased to see [me]659-i . [The girl]2594-the girl ’s sensitive nature sunk under the shock . [She]2594-the girl had now [no elder woman]2600-no elder woman to comfort and advise [her]2594-the girl ; [she]2594-the girl lived alone with [[her]2594-the girl father]390-her father , who invariably changed the subject whenever [she]2594-the girl spoke of the old times . The secret sorrow that preys on body and mind alike preyed on [her]2594-the girl . A cold , caught at the inclement season , turned to fever . For weeks [she]2594-the girl was in danger of death . When [she]2594-the girl recovered , [her]2594-the girl head had been stripped of its beautiful hair by [the doctor]364-the doctor ’s order . The sacrifice had been necessary to save [her]2594-the girl life . It proved to be , in one respect , a cruel sacrifice — [her]2594-the girl hair never grew plentifully again . When it did reappear , it had completely lost its charming mingled hues of deep red and brown ; it was now of one monotonous light - brown color throughout . At first sight , [[Mary]85-mary ’s Scotch friends]2603-mary ’s scotch friends hardly knew [her]2594-the girl again . But [Nature]100-nature made amends for what the head had lost by what the face and the figure gained . In a year from the date of [her]2594-the girl illness , [the frail little child of the old days]2604-the frail little child of the old days at [Greenwater Broad]5-greenwater broad had ripened , in the bracing Scotch air and the healthy mode of life , into [a comely young woman]2605-a comely young woman . [Her]2594-the girl features were still , as in [her]2594-the girl early years , not regularly beautiful ; but the change in [her]2594-the girl was not the less marked on that account . The wan face had filled out , and the pale complexion had found its color . As to [her]2594-the girl figure , its remarkable development was perceived even by [the rough people about [her]2594-the girl]2606-the rough people about her . Promising nothing when [she]2594-the girl was [a child]2312-a child , it had now sprung into womanly fullness , symmetry , and grace . [It]2594-the girl was a strikingly beautiful figure , in the strictest sense of the word . Morally as well as physically , there were moments , at this period of [their]2608-their lives , when even [[her]2594-the girl own father]2609-her own father hardly recognized [[his]2609-her own father daughter]437-his daughter of former days . [She]2594-the girl had lost [her]2594-the girl childish vivacity — [her]2594-the girl sweet , equable flow of good humor . Silent and self - absorbed , [she]2594-the girl went through the daily routine of [her]2594-the girl duties enduringly . The hope of meeting [me]659-i again had sunk to a dead hope in [her]2594-the girl by this time . [She]2594-the girl made no complaint . The bodily strength that [she]2594-the girl had gained in these later days had its sympathetic influence in steadying [her]2594-the girl mind . When [[her]2594-the girl father]390-her father once or twice ventured to ask if [she]2594-the girl was still thinking of [me]659-i , [she]2594-the girl answered quietly that [she]2594-the girl had brought [herself]2594-the girl to share [his]390-her father opinions . [She]2594-the girl could not doubt that [I]659-i had long since ceased to think of [her]2594-the girl . Even if [I]659-i had remained faithful to [her]2594-the girl , [she]2594-the girl was old enough now to know that the difference between [us]2612-our in rank made [our]2612-our union by marriage an impossibility . It would be best ( [she]2594-the girl thought ) not to refer any more to the past , best to forget [me]659-i , as [I]659-i had forgotten [her]2594-the girl . So [she]2594-the girl spoke now . So , tried by the test of appearances , [Dame Dermody]85-mary ’s confident forecast of [our]2612-our destinies had failed to justify itself , and had taken its place among the predictions that are never fulfilled . The next notable event in the family annals which followed [Mary]85-mary ’s illness happened when [she]2594-the girl had attained the age of nineteen years . Even at this distance of time [my]659-i heart sinks , [my]659-i courage fails [me]659-i , at the critical stage in [my]659-i narrative which [I]659-i have now reached . A storm of unusual severity burst over [the eastern coast of [Scotland]13-scotland]2576-the eastern coast of scotland . Among [the ships that were lost in the tempest]2614-the ships that were lost in the tempest was [a vessel bound from [Holland]16-holland , which was wrecked on [the rocky shore]2616-the rocky shore near [[Dermody]85-mary ’s place of abode]2617-dermody ’s place of abode]2615-a vessel bound from holland , which was wrecked on the rocky shore near dermody ’s place of abode . Leading the way in all good actions , [the bailiff]320-the bailiff led the way in rescuing [the passengers and crew of [the lost ship]2620-the lost ship]2619-the passengers and crew of the lost ship . [He]320-the bailiff had brought [one man alive to land]2621-one man alive to land , and was on [his]320-the bailiff way back to [the vessel]2622-the vessel , when two heavy seas , following in close succession , dashed [him]320-the bailiff against the rocks . [He]320-the bailiff was rescued , at the risk of [their]2623-their own lives , by [[his]320-the bailiff neighbors]2624-his neighbors . The medical examination disclosed a broken bone and severe bruises and lacerations . So far , [Dermody]85-mary ’s sufferings were easy of relief . But , after a lapse of time , symptoms appeared in [the patient]2625-the patient which revealed to [[his]2625-the patient medical attendant]2626-his medical attendant the presence of serious internal injury . In [the doctor]364-the doctor ’s opinion , [he]2625-the patient could never hope to resume the active habits of [his]2625-the patient life . [He]2625-the patient would be [an invalid]2628-an invalid and [a crippled man]2629-a crippled man for the rest of [his]2625-the patient days . Under these melancholy circumstances , [[the bailiff]320-the bailiff ’s employer]2631-the bailiff ’s employer did all that could be strictly expected of [him]320-the bailiff , [He]2631-the bailiff ’s employer hired [an assistant to undertake the supervision of the farm work]2632-an assistant to undertake the supervision of the farm work , and [he]2631-the bailiff ’s employer permitted [Dermody]85-mary to occupy [[his]320-the bailiff cottage]2633-his cottage for the next three months . This concession gave [the poor man]2634-the poor man time to recover such relics of strength as were still left to [him]320-the bailiff , and to consult [[his]320-the bailiff friends]2220-his friends in [Glasgow]14-glasgow on the doubtful question of [his]320-the bailiff life to come . The prospect was a serious one . [Dermody]85-mary was quite unfit for any sedentary employment ; and the little money that [he]320-the bailiff had saved was not enough to support [[his]320-the bailiff daughter]437-his daughter and [himself]320-the bailiff . [The Scotch friends]2637-the scotch friends were willing and kind ; but [they]2637-the scotch friends had domestic claims on [them]2637-the scotch friends , and [they]2637-the scotch friends had no money to spare . In this emergency , [the passenger in [the wrecked vessel]2639-the wrecked vessel ( whose life [Dermody]85-mary had saved]2638-the passenger in the wrecked vessel ( whose life dermody had saved ) came forward with a proposal which took [father]2640-father and [daughter]2405-daughter alike by surprise . [He]320-the bailiff made [Mary]85-mary an offer of marriage ; on the express understanding ( if [she]85-mary accepted [him]320-the bailiff ) that [[her]85-mary home]2642-her home was to be [[[her]85-mary father]390-her father ’s home]2644-her father ’s home also to the end of [his]320-the bailiff life . [The person who thus associated [himself]320-the bailiff with [the Dermodys]101-the dermodys in the time of [their]101-the dermodys trouble]2645-the person who thus associated himself with the dermodys in the time of their trouble was [a Dutch gentleman , named [Ernest Van Brandt]102-mr. van brandt]2646-a dutch gentleman , named ernest van brandt . [He]320-the bailiff possessed a share in [a fishing establishment on [the shores of [the Zuyder Zee]17-the zuyder zee]2648-the shores of the zuyder zee]2647-a fishing establishment on the shores of the zuyder zee ; and [he]320-the bailiff was on [his]320-the bailiff way to establish a correspondence with [the fisheries in [the North of [Scotland]13-scotland]2650-the north of scotland]2649-the fisheries in the north of scotland when [the vessel]2622-the vessel was wrecked . [Mary]85-mary had produced a strong impression on [him]320-the bailiff when [they]101-the dermodys first met . [He]320-the bailiff had lingered in [the neighborhood]2652-the neighborhood , in the hope of gaining [her]85-mary favorable regard , with time to help [him]320-the bailiff . Personally [he]320-the bailiff was [a handsome man]2653-a handsome man , in the prime of life ; and [he]320-the bailiff was possessed of a sufficient income to marry on . In making [his]320-the bailiff proposal , [he]320-the bailiff produced references to [persons of high social position in [Holland]16-holland]2654-persons of high social position in holland , who could answer for [him]320-the bailiff , so far as the questions of character and position were concerned . [Mary]85-mary was long in considering which course it would be best for [[her]85-mary helpless father]2655-her helpless father , and best for [herself]85-mary , to adopt . The hope of a marriage with [me]659-i had been a hope abandoned by [her]85-mary years since . [No woman]2656-no woman looks forward willingly to a life of cheerless celibacy . In thinking of [her]85-mary future , [Mary]85-mary naturally thought of [herself]85-mary in the character of [a wife]2657-a wife . Could [she]85-mary fairly expect in the time to come to receive any more attractive proposal than the proposal now addressed to [her]85-mary ? [Mr. Van Brandt]102-mr. van brandt had every personal advantage that [a woman]237-a woman could desire ; [he]102-mr. van brandt was devotedly in love with [her]85-mary ; and [he]102-mr. van brandt felt a grateful affection for [[her]85-mary father]390-her father as [the man to whom [he]102-mr. van brandt owed [his]102-mr. van brandt life]2660-the man to whom he owed his life . With no other hope in [her]85-mary heart — with no other prospect in view — what could [she]85-mary do better than marry [Mr. Van Brandt]102-mr. van brandt ? Influenced by these considerations , [she]85-mary decided on speaking the fatal word . [She]85-mary said , “[659-i] Yes . ” At the same time , [she]85-mary spoke plainly to [Mr. Van Brandt]102-mr. van brandt , unreservedly acknowledging that [she]85-mary had contemplated another future than the future now set before [her]85-mary . [She]85-mary did not conceal that there had once been an old love in [her]85-mary heart , and that a new love was more than [she]85-mary could command . Esteem , gratitude , and regard [she]85-mary could honestly offer ; and , with time , love might come . For the rest , [she]85-mary had long since disassociated [herself]85-mary from the past , and had definitely given up all the hopes and wishes once connected with it . Repose for [[her]85-mary father]390-her father , and tranquil happiness for [herself]85-mary , were the only favors that [she]85-mary asked of fortune now . These [she]85-mary might find under the roof of [an honorable man who loved and respected [her]85-mary]2662-an honorable man who loved and respected her . [She]85-mary could promise , on [her]85-mary side , to make [him]2662-an honorable man who loved and respected her [a good and faithful wife]2663-a good and faithful wife , if [she]85-mary could promise no more . It rested with [Mr. Van Brandt]102-mr. van brandt to say whether [he]102-mr. van brandt really believed that [he]102-mr. van brandt would be consulting [his]102-mr. van brandt own happiness in marrying [her]85-mary on these terms . [Mr. Van Brandt]102-mr. van brandt accepted the terms without a moment ’s hesitation . [They]2664-they would have been married immediately but for an alarming change for the worse in the condition of [Dermody]85-mary ’s health . Symptoms showed themselves , which [the doctor]364-the doctor confessed that [he]364-the doctor had not anticipated when [he]364-the doctor had given [his]364-the doctor opinion on the case . [He]364-the doctor warned [Mary]85-mary that the end might be near . [A physician]2666-a physician was summoned from [Edinburgh]18-edinburgh , at [Mr. Van Brandt]102-mr. van brandt ’s expense . [He]364-the doctor confirmed the opinion entertained by [the country doctor]2667-the country doctor . For some days longer [the good bailiff]362-the good bailiff lingered . On the last morning , [he]362-the good bailiff put [[his]362-the good bailiff daughter]437-his daughter ’s hand in [Van Brandt]102-mr. van brandt ’s hand . “[659-i] Make [her]662-her happy , [sir]2230-sir , ” [he]362-the good bailiff said , in [his]362-the good bailiff simple way , “[659-i] and [you]2230-sir will be even with [me]0-i for saving [your]2230-sir life . ” The same day [he]362-the good bailiff died quietly in [[his]362-the good bailiff daughter]437-his daughter ’s arms . [Mary]85-mary ’s future was now entirely in [[her]85-mary lover]2671-her lover ’s hands . [The relatives in [Glasgow]14-glasgow]2672-the relatives in glasgow had [daughters]2673-daughters of [their]2672-the relatives in glasgow own to provide for . [The relatives in [London]2-london]2674-the relatives in london resented [Dermody]85-mary ’s neglect of [them]2674-the relatives in london . [Van Brandt]102-mr. van brandt waited , delicately and considerately , until the first violence of [the girl]2594-the girl ’s grief had worn itself out , and then [he]102-mr. van brandt pleaded irresistibly for [a husband]2676-a husband ’s claim to console [her]2594-the girl . The time at which [they]2672-the relatives in glasgow were married in [Scotland]13-scotland was also the time at which [I]2230-sir was on [my]2230-sir way [home]2233-home from [India]9-india . [Mary]85-mary had then reached the age of twenty years . The story of [our]2678-our ten years ’ separation is now told ; the narrative leaves [us]2678-our at the outset of [our]2678-our new lives . [I]2230-sir am with [[my]2230-sir mother]365-my mother , beginning [my]2230-sir career as [a country gentleman on [the estate in [Perthshire]12-perthshire which [I]2230-sir have inherited from [Mr. Germaine]74-mr. germaine]2681-the estate in perthshire which i have inherited from mr. germaine]2680-a country gentleman on the estate in perthshire which i have inherited from mr. germaine . [Mary]85-mary is with [[her]85-mary husband]206-her husband , enjoying [her]85-mary new privileges , learning [her]85-mary new duties , as [a wife]2657-a wife . [She]85-mary , too , is living in [Scotland]13-scotland — living , by a strange fatality , not very far distant from [[my]2230-sir country - house]2684-my country - house . [I]2230-sir have no suspicion that [she]85-mary is so near to [me]2230-sir : the name of [Mrs. Van Brandt]103-mrs. van brandt ( even if [I]2230-sir had heard it ) appeals to no familiar association in [my]2230-sir mind . Still the kindred spirits are parted . Still there is no idea on [her]85-mary side , and no idea on [mine]2230-sir , that [we]2685-we shall ever meet again . “[2230-sir] [I]0-i have been hanging a little picture in [[my]0-i room]2363-my room , ” [she]0-i said . “[0-i] Come [upstairs]665-upstairs , [[my]0-i dear]657-my dear , and give [me]0-i [your]657-my dear opinion of it . ” [I]657-my dear rose and followed [her]0-i . [She]0-i pointed to a miniature portrait , hanging above the mantelpiece . “[657-my dear] Do [you]657-my dear know whose likeness that is ? ” [she]0-i asked , half sadly , half playfully . “[74-mr. germaine] [George]74-mr. germaine ! Do [you]657-my dear really not recognize [yourself]657-my dear at thirteen years old ? ” How should [I]657-my dear recognize [myself]657-my dear ? Worn by sickness and sorrow ; browned by the sun on [my]657-my dear long homeward voyage ; [my]657-my dear hair already growing thin over [my]657-my dear forehead ; [my]657-my dear eyes already habituated to their one sad and weary look ; what had [I]657-my dear in common with [the fair , plump , curly - headed , bright - eyed boy who confronted [me]657-my dear in the miniature]2686-the fair , plump , curly - headed , bright - eyed boy who confronted me in the miniature ? The mere sight of the portrait produced the most extraordinary effect on [my]657-my dear mind . It struck [me]657-my dear with an overwhelming melancholy ; it filled [me]657-my dear with a despair of [myself]657-my dear too dreadful to be endured . Making the best excuse [I]657-my dear could to [[my]657-my dear mother]365-my mother , [I]657-my dear left [the room]185-the room . In another minute [I]657-my dear was out of [the house]258-the house . [I]657-my dear crossed [the park]2690-the park , and left [my]657-my dear own possessions behind [me]657-my dear . Following [a by - road]2691-a by - road , [I]657-my dear came to [[our]2692-our well - known river]2693-our well - known river ; so beautiful in itself , so famous among [trout - fishers throughout [Scotland]13-scotland]2694-trout - fishers throughout scotland . It was not then the fishing season . [No human being]2695-no human being was in sight as [I]657-my dear took [my]657-my dear seat on [the bank]337-the bank . [The old stone bridge which spanned [the stream]2698-the stream]2697-the old stone bridge which spanned the stream was within a hundred yards of [me]657-my dear ; the setting sun still tinged the swift - flowing water under the arches with its red and dying light . Still [the boy]580-the boy ’s face in the miniature pursued [me]657-my dear . Still the portrait seemed to reproach [me]657-my dear in a merciless language of its own : “[657-my dear] Look at what [you]667-you were once ; think of what [you]667-you are now ! ” [I]657-my dear hid [my]657-my dear face in the soft , fragrant grass . [I]657-my dear thought of the wasted years of [my]657-my dear life between thirteen and twenty - three . How was it to end ? If [I]657-my dear lived to the ordinary life of [man]178-man , what prospect had [I]657-my dear before [me]657-my dear ? Love ? Marriage ? [I]657-my dear burst out laughing as the idea crossed [my]657-my dear mind . Since the innocently happy days of [my]657-my dear boyhood [I]657-my dear had known no more of love than the insect that now crept over [my]657-my dear hand as it lay on the grass . [My]657-my dear money , to be sure , would buy [me]657-my dear [a wife]2657-a wife ; but would [my]657-my dear money make [her]2657-a wife dear to [me]657-my dear ? dear as [Mary]85-mary had once been , in the golden time when [my]657-my dear portrait was first painted ? [Mary]85-mary ! Was [she]85-mary still living ? Was [she]85-mary married ? Should [I]657-my dear know [her]85-mary again if [I]657-my dear saw [her]85-mary ? Absurd ! [I]657-my dear had not seen [her]85-mary since [she]85-mary was ten years old : [she]85-mary was now [a woman]237-a woman , as [I]657-my dear was [a man]2326-a man . Would [she]85-mary know [me]657-my dear if [we]2704-we met ? The portrait , still pursuing [me]657-my dear , answered the question : “[657-my dear] Look at what [you]668-you were once ; think of what [you]668-you are now ! ” [I]657-my dear rose and walked backward and forward , and tried to turn the current of [my]657-my dear thoughts in some new direction . It was not to be done . After a banishment of years , [Mary]85-mary had got back again into [my]657-my dear mind . [I]657-my dear sat down once more on [the river bank]2705-the river bank . The sun was sinking fast . Black shadows hovered under [the arches of [the old stone bridge]2707-the old stone bridge]2706-the arches of the old stone bridge . The red light had faded from the swift - flowing water , and had left [it]2708-it overspread with one monotonous hue of steely gray . The first stars looked down peacefully from the cloudless sky . The first shiverings of the night breeze were audible among the trees , and visible here and there in [the shallow places of [the stream]2698-the stream]2709-the shallow places of the stream . And still , the darker it grew , the more persistently [my]657-my dear portrait led [me]657-my dear back to the past , the more vividly the long - lost image of [the child]2711-the child [Mary]85-mary showed itself to [me]657-my dear in [my]657-my dear thoughts . Was this the prelude of [her]85-mary coming back to [me]657-my dear in dreams ; in [her]85-mary perfected womanhood , in the young prime of [her]85-mary life ? It might be so . [I]657-my dear was no longer unworthy of [her]85-mary , as [I]657-my dear had once been . The effect produced on [me]657-my dear by the sight of [my]657-my dear portrait was in itself due to moral and mental changes in [me]657-my dear for the better , which had been steadily proceeding since the time when [my]657-my dear wound had laid [me]657-my dear helpless among [strangers]2712-strangers in [a strange land]2713-a strange land . Sickness , which has made itself [teacher]2714-teacher and [friend]2715-friend to [many a man]2716-many a man , had made [itself]2717-itself [teacher]2714-teacher and [friend]2715-friend to [me]657-my dear . [I]657-my dear looked back with horror at the vices of [my]657-my dear youth ; at the fruitless after - days when [I]657-my dear had impiously doubted all that is most noble , all that is most consoling in human life . Consecrated by sorrow , purified by repentance , was it vain in [me]657-my dear to hope that [her]85-mary spirit a nd [my]657-my dear spirit might yet be united again ? Who could tell ? [I]657-my dear rose once more . It could serve no good purpose to linger until night by [the banks of [the river]2721-the river]2720-the banks of the river . [I]657-my dear had left [the house]258-the house , feeling the impulse which drives [us]2723-us , in certain excited conditions of the mind , to take refuge in movement and change . The remedy had failed ; [my]657-my dear mind was as strangely disturbed as ever . [My]657-my dear wisest course would be to go [home]2233-home , and keep [[my]657-my dear good mother]2400-my good mother company over [her]2400-my good mother favorite game of piquet . [I]657-my dear turned to take [the road]2726-the road back , and stopped , struck by the tranquil beauty of the last faint light in the western sky , shining behind the black line formed by the parapet of [the bridge]2727-the bridge . In the grand gathering of the night shadows , in the deep stillness of the dying day , [I]657-my dear stood alone and watched the sinking light . As [I]657-my dear looked , there came a change over the scene . Suddenly and softly a living figure glided into view on [the bridge]2727-the bridge . [It]2729-it passed behind the black line of the parapet , in the last long rays of the western light . [It]2729-it crossed [the bridge]2727-the bridge . [It]2729-it paused , and crossed back again half - way . Then it stopped . The minutes passed , and there [the figure]2731-the figure stood , a motionless black object , behind the black parapet of [the bridge]2727-the bridge . [I]657-my dear advanced a little , moving near enough to obtain a closer view of the dress in which [the figure]2731-the figure was attired . The dress showed [me]657-my dear that [the solitary stranger]2734-the solitary stranger was [a woman]237-a woman . [She]237-a woman did not notice [me]657-my dear in the shadow which the trees cast on [the bank]337-the bank . [She]237-a woman stood with [her]237-a woman arms folded in [her]237-a woman cloak , looking down at [the darkening river]2737-the darkening river . Why was [she]237-a woman waiting there at the close of evening alone ? As the question occurred to [me]657-my dear , [I]657-my dear saw [her]237-a woman head move . [She]237-a woman looked along [the bridge]2727-the bridge , first on one side of [her]237-a woman , then on the other . Was [she]237-a woman waiting for [some person who was to meet [her]237-a woman]2739-some person who was to meet her ? Or was [she]237-a woman suspicious of observation , and anxious to make sure that [she]237-a woman was alone ? A sudden doubt of [her]237-a woman purpose in seeking [that solitary place]2740-that solitary place , a sudden distrust of [the lonely bridge]2741-the lonely bridge and [the swift - flowing river]2742-the swift - flowing river , set [my]657-my dear heart beating quickly and roused [me]657-my dear to instant action . [I]657-my dear hurried up the rising ground which led from [the river - bank]2743-the river - bank to [the bridge]2727-the bridge , determined on speaking to [her]237-a woman while the opportunity was still [mine]657-my dear . [She]237-a woman neither saw nor heard [me]657-my dear until [I]657-my dear was close to [her]237-a woman . [I]657-my dear approached with an irrepressible feeling of agitation ; not knowing how [she]237-a woman might receive [me]657-my dear when [I]657-my dear spoke to [her]237-a woman . The moment [she]237-a woman turned and faced [me]657-my dear , [my]657-my dear composure came back . It was as if , expecting to see [a stranger]2745-a stranger , [I]657-my dear had unexpectedly encountered [a friend]2746-a friend . And yet [she]237-a woman was [a stranger]2745-a stranger . [I]657-my dear had never before looked on that grave and noble face , on that grand figure whose exquisite grace and symmetry even [her]237-a woman long cloak could not wholly hide . [She]237-a woman was not , perhaps , [a strictly beautiful woman]2748-a strictly beautiful woman . There were defects in [her]237-a woman which were sufficiently marked to show themselves in the fading light . [Her]237-a woman hair , for example , seen under the large garden hat that [she]237-a woman wore , looked almost as short as the hair of [a man]2326-a man ; and the color of it was of that dull , lusterless brown hue which is so commonly seen in [English women of the ordinary type]2750-english women of the ordinary type . Still , in spite of these drawbacks , there was a latent charm in [her]237-a woman expression , there was an inbred fascination in [her]237-a woman manner , which instantly found its way to [my]657-my dear sympathies and its hold on [my]657-my dear admiration . [She]237-a woman won [me]657-my dear in the moment when [I]657-my dear first looked at [her]237-a woman . “[657-my dear] May [I]0-i inquire if [you]669-you have lost [your]669-you way ? ” [I]0-i asked . [Her]237-a woman eyes rested on [my]0-i face with a strange look of inquiry in them . [She]237-a woman did not appear to be surprised or confused at [my]0-i venturing to address [her]237-a woman . “[0-i] [I]0-i know [this part of [the country]671-the country]670-this part of the country well , ” [I]0-i went on . “[0-i] Can [I]0-i be of any use to [you]669-you ? ” [She]237-a woman still looked at [me]0-i with steady , inquiring eyes . For a moment , stranger as [I]0-i was , [my]0-i face seemed to trouble [her]237-a woman as if it had been a face that [she]237-a woman had seen and forgotten again . If [she]237-a woman really had this idea , [she]237-a woman at once dismissed it with a little toss of [her]237-a woman head , and looked away at [the river]2721-the river as if [she]237-a woman felt no further interest in [me]0-i . “[0-i] Thank [you]0-i . [I]0-i have not lost [my]0-i way . [I]0-i am accustomed to walking alone . Good - evening . ” [She]237-a woman spoke coldly , but courteously . [Her]237-a woman voice was delicious ; [her]237-a woman bow , as [she]237-a woman left [me]94-christ , was the perfection of unaffected grace . [She]237-a woman left [the bridge]2727-the bridge on the side by which [I]94-christ had first seen [her]237-a woman approach [it]2727-the bridge , and walked slowly away along the darkening track of [the highroad]2753-the highroad . Still [I]94-christ was not quite satisfied . There was something underlying the charming expression and the fascinating manner which [my]94-christ instinct felt to be something wrong . As [I]94-christ walked away toward the opposite end of [the bridge]2727-the bridge , the doubt began to grow on [me]94-christ whether [she]237-a woman had spoken the truth . In leaving [the neighborhood of]2755-the neighborhood of [the river]2721-the river , was [she]237-a woman simply trying to get rid of [me]94-christ ? [I]94-christ at once resolved to put this suspicion of [her]237-a woman to the test . Leaving [the bridge]2727-the bridge , [I]94-christ had only to cross [the road beyond]2758-the road beyond , and to enter [a plantation on [the bank of [the river]2721-the river]2760-the bank of the river]2759-a plantation on the bank of the river . Here , concealed behind the first tree which was large enough to hide [me]94-christ , [I]94-christ could command a view of [the bridge]2727-the bridge , and [I]94-christ could fairly count on detecting [her]237-a woman , if [she]237-a woman returned to [the river]2721-the river , while there was a ray of light to see [her]237-a woman by . It was not easy walking in the obscurity of [the plantation]2764-the plantation : [I]94-christ had almost to grope [my]94-christ way to the nearest tree that suited [my]94-christ purpose . [I]94-christ had just steadied [my]94-christ foothold on the uneven ground behind the tree , when the stillness of the twilight hour was suddenly broken by the distant sound of a voice . The voice was [a woman]237-a woman ’s . It was not raised to any high pitch ; its accent was the accent of prayer , and the words it uttered were these : “[94-christ] [Christ]94-christ , have mercy on [me]0-i ! ” There was silence again . A nameless fear crept over [me]94-christ , as [I]94-christ looked out on [the bridge]2727-the bridge . [She]237-a woman was standing on the parapet . Before [I]94-christ could move , before [I]94-christ could cry out , before [I]94-christ could even breathe again freely , [she]237-a woman leaped into [the river]2721-the river . The current ran [my]94-christ way . [I]94-christ could see [her]237-a woman , as [she]237-a woman rose to the surface , floating by in the light on [the mid - stream]2768-the mid - stream . [I]94-christ ran headlong down [the bank]337-the bank . [She]237-a woman sank again , in the moment when [I]94-christ stopped to throw aside [my]94-christ hat and coat and to kick off [my]94-christ shoes . [I]94-christ was [a practiced swimmer]2770-a practiced swimmer . The instant [I]94-christ was in [the water]326-the water [my]94-christ composure came back to [me]94-christ — [I]94-christ felt like [myself]94-christ again . The current swept [me]94-christ out into [the mid - stream]2768-the mid - stream , and greatly increased the speed at which [I]94-christ swam . [I]94-christ was close behind [her]237-a woman when [she]237-a woman rose for the second time — a shadowy thing , just visible a few inches below the surface of [the river]2721-the river . One more stroke , and [my]94-christ left arm was round [her]237-a woman ; [I]94-christ had [her]237-a woman face out of the water . [She]237-a woman was insensible . [I]94-christ could hold [her]237-a woman in the right way to leave [me]94-christ master of all [my]94-christ movements ; [I]94-christ could devote [myself]94-christ , without flurry or fatigue , to the exertion of taking [her]237-a woman back to [the shore]2463-the shore . [My]94-christ first attempt satisfied [me]94-christ that there was no reasonable hope , burdened as [I]94-christ now was , of breasting the strong current running toward [the mid - river from either bank]2775-the mid - river from either bank . [I]94-christ tried it on one side , and [I]94-christ tried it on the other , and gave it up . The one choice left was to let [myself]94-christ drift with [her]237-a woman down [the stream]2698-the stream . Some fifty yards lower , [the river]2721-the river took a turn round [a promontory of land]2778-a promontory of land , on which stood [a little inn much frequented by anglers in the season]2779-a little inn much frequented by anglers in the season . As [we]2780-we approached [the place]2384-the place , [I]94-christ made another attempt ( again an attempt in vain ) to reach [the shore]2463-the shore . [Our]2780-we last chance now was to be heard by [the people of [the inn]2784-the inn]2783-the people of the inn . [I]94-christ shouted at the full pitch of [my]94-christ voice as [we]2780-we drifted past . The cry was answered . [A man]2326-a man put off in [a boat]2786-a boat . In five minutes more [I]94-christ had [her]237-a woman safe on [the bank]337-the bank again ; and [the man]2308-the man and [I]94-christ were carrying [her]237-a woman to [the inn]2784-the inn by [the river - side]2790-the river - side . [The landlady]2791-the landlady and [[her]2791-the landlady servant - girl]2792-her servant - girl were equally willing to be of service , and equally ignorant of what [they]2793-they were to do . Fortunately , [my]94-christ medical education made [me]94-christ competent to direct [them]2793-they . A good fire , warm blankets , hot water in bottles , were all at [my]94-christ disposal . [I]94-christ showed [the women]2794-the women [myself]94-christ how to ply the work of revival . [They]2794-the women persevered , and [I]94-christ persevered ; and still there [she]237-a woman lay , in [her]237-a woman perfect beauty of form , without a sign of life perceptible ; there [she]237-a woman lay , to all outward appearance , dead by drowning . A last hope was left — the hope of restoring [her]237-a woman ( if [I]94-christ could construct the apparatus in time ) by the process called “[94-christ] artificial respiration . ” [I]672-good god was just endeavoring to tell [the landlady]2791-the landlady what [I]672-good god wanted and was just conscious o f a strange difficulty in expressing [myself]672-good god , when [the good woman]2796-the good woman started back , and looked at [me]672-good god with a scream of terror . “[672-good god] [Good God]672-good god , [sir]2230-sir , [you]2230-sir ’re bleeding ! ” [she]2796-the good woman cried . “[672-good god] What ’s the matter ? Where are [you]2230-sir hurt ? ” In the moment when [she]2796-the good woman spoke to [me]674-doctor [I]674-doctor knew what had happened . The old Indian wound ( irritated , doubtless , by the violent exertion that [I]674-doctor had imposed on [myself]674-doctor ) had opened again . [I]674-doctor struggled against the sudden sense of faintness that seized on [me]674-doctor ; [I]674-doctor tried to tell [the people of [the inn]2784-the inn]2783-the people of the inn what to do . It was useless . [I]674-doctor dropped to [my]674-doctor knees ; [my]674-doctor head sunk on the bosom of [the woman]2309-the woman stretched senseless upon the low couch beneath [me]674-doctor . The death - in - life that had got [her]2309-the woman had got [me]674-doctor . Lost to [the world]287-the world about [us]2801-us , [we]2801-us lay , with [my]674-doctor blood flowing on [her]2309-the woman , united in [our]2801-us deathly trance . Where were [our]2801-us spirits at that moment ? Were [they]2802-they together and conscious of [each other]354-each other ? United by a spiritual bond , undiscovered and unsuspected by [us]2801-us in the flesh , did [[we]2801-us two , who had met as [strangers on the fatal bridge]2805-strangers on the fatal bridge]2804-we two , who had met as strangers on the fatal bridge , know [each other]354-each other again in the trance ? [[You]2807-you who have loved and lost]2808-you who have loved and lost — [you]2807-you whose one consolation it has been to believe in [other worlds than this]2809-other worlds than this — can [you]2807-you turn from [my]674-doctor questions in contempt ? Can [you]2807-you honestly say that they have never been [your]2807-you questions too ? THE morning sunlight shining in at a badly curtained window ; a clumsy wooden bed , with big twisted posts that reached to the ceiling ; on one side of the bed , [[my]674-doctor mother]365-my mother ’s welcome face ; on the other side , [an elderly gentleman unremembered by [me]674-doctor at that moment]2811-an elderly gentleman unremembered by me at that moment — such were the objects that presented themselves to [my]674-doctor view , when [I]674-doctor first consciously returned to [the world that [we]2813-we live in]2812-the world that we live in . “[674-doctor] Look , [doctor]674-doctor , look ! [He]675-my has come to [his]675-my senses at last . ” “[675-my] Open [your]674-doctor mouth , [sir]2230-sir , and take a sup of this . ” [[My]674-doctor mother]365-my mother was rejoicing over [me]674-doctor on one side of the bed ; and [the unknown gentleman]2815-the unknown gentleman , addressed as “[674-doctor] [doctor]674-doctor , ” was offering [me]674-doctor a spoonful of whisky - and - water on the other . [He]2815-the unknown gentleman called it the “[674-doctor] elixir of life ” ; and [he]2815-the unknown gentleman bid [me]675-my remark ( speaking in a strong Scotch accent ) that [he]2815-the unknown gentleman tasted it [himself]2815-the unknown gentleman to show [he]2815-the unknown gentleman was in earnest . The stimulant did its good work . [My]675-my head felt less giddy , [my]675-my mind became clearer . [I]675-my could speak collectedly to [[my]675-my mother]365-my mother ; [I]675-my could vaguely recall the more marked events of the previous evening . [I]675-my tried to raise [myself]675-my in the bed ; [I]675-my asked , impatiently , “[675-my] Where is [she]678-she ? ” [The doctor]364-the doctor produced another spoonful of the elixir of life , and gravely repeated [his]364-the doctor first address to [me]2230-sir . “[2230-sir] Open [your]679-your mouth , [sir]2230-sir , and take a sup of this . ” [I]2230-sir persisted in repeating [my]2230-sir question : “[2230-sir] Where is [she]678-she ? ” [The doctor]364-the doctor persisted in repeating [his]364-the doctor formula : “[2230-sir] Take a sup of this . ” [I]2230-sir was too weak to contest the matter ; [I]2230-sir obeyed . [My]0-i business ( now [I]0-i had done with [the lady]2202-the lady ) was [upstairs]665-upstairs in [this room]755-this room , to see how [you]0-i were getting on . [You]0-i were getting on as well as [I]0-i could wish , and [[your]0-i mother]2252-your mother was at [your]0-i bedside . [I]0-i went [home]2233-home to see what [sick people]758-sick people might be waiting for [me]0-i in the regular way . When [I]0-i came back this morning , there was [the foolish landlady]759-the foolish landlady with a new tale to tell ‘ Gone ! ’ says [she]759-the foolish landlady . ‘ Who ’s gone ? ’ says [I.]0-i ‘ [The lady]2202-the lady , ’ says [she]759-the foolish landlady , ‘ by [the first coach]750-the first coach this morning ! ’ ” “[759-the foolish landlady] [You]0-i do n’t mean to tell [me]0-i that [she]2202-the lady has left [the house]258-the house ? ” [I]0-i exclaimed . “[0-i] Oh , but [I]0-i do ! ” said [the doctor]364-the doctor , as positively as ever . “[0-i] Ask [madam]2256-madam [[your]0-i mother]2252-your mother here , and [she]2256-madam ’ll certify it to [your]0-i heart ’s content . [You]0-i ’ll see no more of [the lady]2202-the lady ; and so much the better , [I]0-i ’m thinking . There is some dreadful calamity , [George]74-mr. germaine , in [that wretched woman]781-that wretched woman ’s life . And such [an interesting creature]782-an interesting creature , too ! [I]0-i felt a purely imaginary ( perhaps [I]0-i ought to say , a purely superstitious ) conviction that [we]2842-we who had nearly died together , [we]2842-we who had been brought to life together , were surely destined to be involved in some future joys or sorrows common to [us]2842-we both . “[0-i] [I]0-i fancy [I]0-i shall see [her]789-her again , ” was [my]2715-friend last thought before [my]2715-friend weakness overpowered [me]2715-friend , and [I]2715-friend sunk into a peaceful sleep . [I]2715-friend awoke with this idea ; and [I]2715-friend slept no more that night . [[My]2715-friend mother]365-my mother had a great admiration of [the place]2384-the place , and had often expressed a wish to possess some memorial of [it]2384-the place . [I]2715-friend resolved to take [my]2715-friend sketch - book : with [me]2715-friend , on the chance that [I]2715-friend might be able to please [her]365-my mother by making a drawing of [her]365-my mother favorite scene . [We]2859-we drove to [the waterfall]2863-the waterfall . It was a beautiful day ; the lonely sylvan scene was at its brightest and best . [A wooden summer - house , commanding a prospect of]2864-a wooden summer - house , commanding a prospect of [the falling stream]2865-the falling stream , had been built for the accommodation of pleasure parties by [the proprietor of [the place]2384-the place]2866-the proprietor of the place .
