[You]2054-you have generously forgotten it . [I]0-i must bear it in mind . [I]0-i dare say [I]0-i am cold . Suffering has that effect on [me]0-i ; and , [I]0-i own it , [I]0-i am suffering now . ” [I]0-i was too passionately in love with [her]2054-you to feel the sympathy on which [she]2054-you evidently counted in saying those words . [A man]2326-a man can respect [a woman]237-a woman ’s scruples when [they]4461-they appeal to [him]2326-a man mutely in [her]237-a woman looks or in [her]237-a woman tears ; but the formal expression of them in words only irritates or annoys [him]2326-a man . “[0-i] Whose fault is it that [you]0-i suffer ? ” [I]0-i retorted , coldly . “[0-i] [I]0-i ask [you]0-i to make [my]0-i life a happy one , and [your]0-i life a happy one . [You]0-i are [a cruelly wronged woman]2081-a cruelly wronged woman , but [you]0-i are not [a degraded woman]2082-a degraded woman . [You]0-i are worthy to be [[my]0-i wife]144-my wife , and [I]0-i am ready to declare it publicly . Come back with [me]0-i to [England]1-england . [[My]0-i boat]392-my boat is waiting for [you]0-i ; [we]2085-we can set sail in two hours . ” [She]0-i dropped into a chair ; [her]0-i hands fell helplessly into [her]0-i lap . “[0-i] How cruel ! ” [she]0-i murmured , “[0-i] how cruel to tempt [me]0-i ! ” [She]0-i waited a little , and recovered [her]0-i fatal firmness . “[0-i] No ! ” [she]0-i said . “[0-i] If [I]0-i die in doing it , [I]0-i can still refuse to disgrace [you]0-i . Leave [me]0-i , [Mr. Germaine]74-mr. germaine . [You]0-i can show [me]0-i that one kindness more . For [God]93-god ’s sake , leave [me]0-i ! ” [I]93-god made a last appeal to [her]0-i tenderness . “[93-god] Do [you]0-i know what [my]0-i life is if [I]0-i live without [you]0-i ? ” [I]0-i asked . “[0-i] [[My]0-i mother]365-my mother is dead . There is not a living creature left in [the world]287-the world whom [I]0-i love but [you]0-i . And [you]0-i ask [me]0-i to leave [you]0-i ! Where am [I]0-i to go to ? what am [I]0-i to do ? [You]0-i talk of cruelty ! Is there no cruelty in sacrificing the happiness of [my]0-i life to a miserable scruple of delicacy , to an unreasoning fear of the opinion of [the world]287-the world ? [I]0-i love [you]0-i and [you]0-i love [me]0-i . There is no other consideration worth a straw . Come back with [me]0-i to [England]1-england ! come back and be [[my]0-i wife]144-my wife ! ” [She]0-i dropped on [her]0-i knees , and taking [my]144-my wife hand put it silently to [her]0-i lips . [I]144-my wife tried to raise [her]0-i . It was useless : [she]0-i steadily resisted [me]144-my wife . “[144-my wife] Does this mean No ? ” [I]144-my wife asked . “[144-my wife] It means , ” [she]0-i said in faint , broken tones , “[144-my wife] that [I]0-i prize [your]0-i honor beyond [my]0-i happiness . If [I]0-i marry [you]0-i , [your]0-i career is destroyed by [[your]0-i wife]2205-your wife ; and the day will come when [you]0-i will tell [me]0-i so . [I]0-i can suffer — [I]0-i can die ; but [I]0-i can not face such a prospect as that . Forgive [me]0-i and forget [me]0-i . [I]0-i can say no more ! ” [She]0-i let go of [my]0-i hand , and sank on the floor . The utter despair of that action told [me]0-i , far more eloquently than the words which [she]0-i had just spoken , that [her]0-i resolution was immovable . [She]0-i had deliberately separated [herself]0-i from [me]0-i ; [her]0-i own act had parted [us]4462-us forever . [I]0-i MADE no movement to leave [the room]185-the room ; [I]0-i let no sign of sorrow escape [me]0-i . At last , [my]0-i heart was hardened against [the woman who had so obstinately rejected [me]0-i]4464-the woman who had so obstinately rejected me . [I]0-i stood looking down at [her]0-i with a merciless anger , the bare remembrance of which fills [me]0-i at this day with a horror of [myself]0-i . There is but one excuse for [me]0-i . The shock of that last overthrow of the one hope that held [me]0-i to life was more than [my]0-i reason could endure . On that dreadful night ( whatever [I]0-i may have been at other times ) , [I]0-i [myself]0-i believe it , [I]0-i was [a maddened man]4465-a maddened man . [I]0-i was the first to break the silence . “[0-i] Get up , ” [I]0-i said coldly . [She]0-i lifted [her]0-i face from the floor , and looked at [me]0-i as if [she]0-i doubted whether [she]0-i had heard aright . “[0-i] Put on [your]2091-your hat and cloak , ” [I]0-i resumed . “[0-i] [I]0-i must ask [you]2091-your to go back with [me]0-i as far as [the boat]2461-the boat . ” [She]0-i rose slowly . [Her]0-i eyes rested on [my]0-i face with a dull , bewildered look . “[0-i] Why am [I]0-i to go with [you]0-i to [the boat]2461-the boat ? ” [she]0-i asked . [The child]2711-the child heard [her]0-i . [The child]2711-the child ran up to [us]4468-us with [her]2711-the child little hat in one hand , and the key of [the cabin]4187-the cabin in the other . “[0-i] [I]0-i ’m ready , ” [she]0-i said . “[0-i] [I]0-i will open the cabin door . ” [[Her]2711-the child mother]1190-her mother signed to [her]2711-the child to go back to the bed - chamber . [She]2711-the child went back as far as the door which led into [the courtyard]4421-the courtyard , and waited there , listening . [I]0-i turned to [Mrs. Van Brandt]103-mrs. van brandt with immovable composure , and answered the question which [she]103-mrs. van brandt had addressed to [me]0-i . “[0-i] [You]2094-you are left , ” [I]2094-you said , “[2094-you] without the means of getting away from [this place]1758-this place . In two hours more the tide will be in [my]0-i favor , and [I]0-i shall sail at once on the return voyage . [We]2096-we part , this time , never to meet again . Before [I]0-i go [I]0-i am resolved to leave [you]2094-you properly provided for . [My]0-i money is in [my]0-i traveling - bag in [the cabin]4187-the cabin . For that reason , [I]0-i am obliged to ask [you]2094-you to go with [me]0-i as far as [the boat]2461-the boat . ” “[0-i] [I]0-i thank [you]0-i gratefully for [your]0-i kindness , ” [she]2094-you said . “[0-i] [I]0-i do n’t stand in such serious need of help as [you]0-i suppose . ” “[0-i] It is useless to attempt to deceive [me]0-i , ” [I]0-i proceeded . “[0-i] [I]0-i have spoken with [the head partner of [the house of [Van Brandt]103-mrs. van brandt at [Amsterdam]61-amsterdam]2100-the house of van brandt at amsterdam]2099-the head partner of the house of van brandt at amsterdam , and [I]0-i know exactly what [your]2094-you position is . [Your]2094-you pride must bend low enough to take from [my]0-i hands the means of subsistence for [yourself]2094-you and [[your]2094-you child]2059-your child . If [I]0-i had died in [England]1-england — ” [I]0-i stopped . The unexpressed idea in [my]0-i mind was to tell [her]2059-your child that [she]2059-your child would inherit a legacy under [my]0-i will , and that [she]2059-your child might quite as becomingly take money from [me]0-i in [my]0-i life - time as take it from [[my]0-i executors]4472-my executors after [my]0-i death . In forming this thought into words , the associations which it called naturally into being revived in [me]0-i the memory of [my]0-i contemplated suicide in [the Greenwater lake]3977-the greenwater lake . Mingling with the remembrance thus aroused , there rose in [me]0-i unbidden , a temptation so overpoweringly vile , and yet so irresistible in the state of [my]0-i mind at the moment , that it shook [me]0-i to the soul . “[0-i] [You]0-i have nothing to live for , now that [she]2102-her has refused to be [yours]0-i , ” [the fiend in [me]0-i]4474-the fiend in me whispered . “[0-i] Take [your]0-i leap into [the next world]2103-the next world , and make [the woman whom [you]0-i love]2104-the woman whom you love take it with [you]0-i ! ” While [I]0-i was still looking at [her]2102-her , while [my]0-i last words to [her]2102-her faltered on [my]0-i lips , the horrible facilities for the perpetration of the double crime revealed themselves enticingly to [my]0-i view . [[My]0-i boat]392-my boat was moored in [the one part of [the decaying harbor in which [deep water]4478-deep water still lay at the foot of [the quay]4479-the quay]4477-the decaying harbor in which deep water still lay at the foot of the quay]4476-the one part of the decaying harbor in which deep water still lay at the foot of the quay . [I]0-i had only to induce [her]2102-her to follow [me]0-i when [I]0-i stepped on [the deck]4480-the deck , to seize [her]2102-her in [my]0-i arms , and to jump overboard with [her]2102-her before [she]2102-her could utter a cry for help . [[My]0-i drowsy sailors]4481-my drowsy sailors , as [I]0-i knew by experience , were hard to wake , and slow to move even when [they]4481-my drowsy sailors were roused at last . [We]4482-we should both be drowned before [the youngest]4483-the youngest and the quickest of [them]4481-my drowsy sailors could get up from [his]4483-the youngest bed and make [his]4483-the youngest way to [the deck]4480-the deck . Yes ! [We]4482-we should both be struck together out of the ranks of [the living]4485-the living at one and the same moment . And why not ? [[She]2102-her who had again and again refused to be [[my]0-i wife]144-my wife]4486-she who had again and again refused to be my wife — did [she]2102-her deserve that [I]0-i should leave [her]2102-her free to go back , perhaps , for the second time to [Van Brandt]103-mrs. van brandt ? On the evening when [I]0-i had saved [her]2102-her from [the waters of [the Scotch river]55-the scotch river]4488-the waters of the scotch river , [I]0-i had made [myself]0-i master of [her]2102-her fate . [She]2102-her had tried to destroy [herself]2102-her by drowning ; [she]2102-her should drown now , in the arms of [the man who had once thrown [himself]4489-the man who had once thrown himself between her and death between [her]2102-her and death]4489-the man who had once thrown himself between her and death ! Self - abandoned to such atrocious reasoning as this , [I]0-i stood face to face with [her]2102-her , and returned deliberately to [my]0-i unfinished sentence . “[0-i] If [I]0-i had died in [England]1-england , [you]2105-you would have been provided for by [my]0-i will . What [you]2105-you would have taken from [me]0-i then , [you]2105-you may take from [me]0-i now . Come to [the boat]2461-the boat . ” A change passed over [her]2102-her face as [I]139-elfie spoke ; a vague doubt of [me]139-elfie began to show itself in [her]2102-her eyes . [She]2102-her drew back a little , without making any reply . “[139-elfie] Come to [the boat]2461-the boat , ” [I]139-elfie reiterated . “[139-elfie] It is too late . ” With that answer , [she]2102-her looked across [the room]185-the room at [the child]2711-the child , still waiting by the door . “[139-elfie] Come , [Elfie]139-elfie , ” [she]2102-her said , calling [the little creature]3600-the little creature by one of [her]2102-her favorite nicknames . “[139-elfie] Come to bed . ” [I]139-elfie too looked at [Elfie]139-elfie . Might [she]139-elfie not , [I]139-elfie asked [myself]139-elfie , be made the innocent means of forcing [[her]139-elfie mother]1190-her mother to leave [the house]258-the house ? Trusting to [the child]2711-the child ’s fearless character , and [her]2102-her eagerness to see [the boat]2461-the boat , [I]139-elfie suddenly opened the door . As [I]139-elfie had anticipated , [she]2102-her instantly ran out . The second door , leading into [the square]4497-the square , [I]139-elfie had not closed when [I]139-elfie entered [the courtyard]4421-the courtyard . In another moment [Elfie]139-elfie was out in [the square]4497-the square , triumphing in [her]139-elfie freedom . The shrill little voice broke the death - like stillness of [the place]2384-the place and hour , calling to [me]139-elfie again and again to take [her]139-elfie to [the boat]2461-the boat . [I]139-elfie turned to [Mrs. Van Brandt]103-mrs. van brandt . [The stratagem]4502-the stratagem had succeeded . [[Elfie]139-elfie ’s mother]4503-elfie ’s mother could hardly refuse to follow when [Elfie]139-elfie led the way . “[139-elfie] Will [you]2108-her go with [us]2109-us ? ” [I]2108-her asked . “[2108-her] Or must [I]0-i send the money back by [the child]2711-the child ? ” [Her]2108-her eyes rested on [me]0-i for a moment with a deepening expression of distrust , then looked away again . [She]2108-her began to turn pale . “[0-i] [You]0-i are not like [yourself]0-i to - night , ” [she]2108-her said . Without a word more , [she]2108-her took [her]2108-her hat and cloak and went out before [me]0-i into [the square]4497-the square . [I]0-i followed [her]2108-her , closing the doors behind [me]0-i . [She]2108-her made an attempt to induce [the child]2711-the child to approach [her]2108-her . “[0-i] Come , [darling]1052-darling , ” [she]2108-her said , enticingly—“come[1052-darling] and take [my]0-i hand . ” But [Elfie]139-elfie was not to be caught : [she]139-elfie took to [her]139-elfie heels , and answered from a safe distance . “[1052-darling] No , ” said [the child]2711-the child ; “[0-i] [you]0-i will take [me]0-i back and put [me]0-i to bed . ” [She]139-elfie retreated a little further , and held up the key : “[0-i] [I]0-i shall go first , ” [she]139-elfie cried , “[0-i] and open the door . ” [She]139-elfie trotted off a few steps in the direction of [the harbor]4224-the harbor , and waited for what was to happen next . [[Her]139-elfie mother]1190-her mother suddenly turned , and looked close at [me]0-i under the light of the stars . “[0-i] Are [the sailors]2112-the sailors on board [the boat]2461-the boat ? ” [she]2108-her asked . The question startled [me]2112-the sailors . Had [she]2108-her any suspicion of [my]2112-the sailors purpose ? Had [my]2112-the sailors face warned [her]2108-her of lurking danger if [she]2108-her went to [the boat]2461-the boat ? It was impossible . The more likely motive for [her]2108-her inquiry was to find a new excuse for not accompanying [me]2112-the sailors to [the harbor]4224-the harbor . If [I]2112-the sailors told [her]2108-her that [the men]1335-the men were on board , [she]2108-her might answer , “[2112-the sailors] Why not employ [one of [[your]2115-your sailors]2116-your sailors]2114-one of your sailors to bring the money to [me]0-i at [the house]258-the house ? ” [I]2116-your sailors took care to anticipate the suggestion in making [my]2116-your sailors reply . “[2116-your sailors] [They]2116-your sailors may be [honest men]2118-honest men , ” [I]2116-your sailors said , watching [her]2108-her carefully ; “[2116-your sailors] but [I]0-i do n’t know [them]2116-your sailors well enough to trust [them]2116-your sailors with money . ” To [my]2119-the sailors on board the boat surprise , [she]2108-her watched [me]2119-the sailors on board the boat just as carefully on [her]2108-her side , and deliberately repeated [her]2108-her question : “[2119-the sailors on board the boat] Are [the sailors on board [the boat]2461-the boat]2119-the sailors on board the boat ? ” [I]2119-the sailors on board the boat informed [her]2108-her that [the captain]851-the captain and [crew]2944-crew slept in [the boat]2461-the boat , and paused to see what would follow . [My]2119-the sailors on board the boat reply seemed to rouse [her]2108-her resolution . After a moment ’s consideration , [she]2108-her turned toward the place at which [the child]2711-the child was waiting for [us]2121-us . “[2119-the sailors on board the boat] Let [us]2121-us go , as [you]2122-i insist on it , ” [she]2108-her said , quietly . [I]2119-the sailors on board the boat made no further remark . Side by side , in silence [we]2121-us followed [Elfie]139-elfie on [our]2121-us way to [the boat]2461-the boat . [Not a human creature]4517-not a human creature passed [us]2121-us in [the streets]929-the streets ; not a light glimmered on [us]2121-us from [the grim black houses]4519-the grim black houses . Twice [the child]2711-the child stopped , and ( still keeping slyly out of [[her]2711-the child mother]1190-her mother ’s reach ) ran back to [me]2119-the sailors on board the boat , wondering at [my]2119-the sailors on board the boat silence . “[2119-the sailors on board the boat] Why do n’t [you]2122-i speak ? ” [she]2108-her asked . “[2122-i] Have [you]2122-i and [mamma]1997-mamma quarreled ? ” [I]2122-i was incapable of answering [her]2108-her — [I]2122-i could think of nothing but [my]2122-i contemplated crime . Neither fear nor remorse troubled [me]2122-i . Every better instinct , every nobler feeling that [I]2122-i had once possessed , seemed to be dead and gone . Not even a thought of [the child]2711-the child ’s future troubled [my]2122-i mind . [I]2122-i had no power of looking on further than the fatal leap from [the boat]2461-the boat : beyond that there was an utter blank . For the time being — [I]2122-i can only repeat it , [my]2122-i moral sense was obscured , [my]2122-i mental faculties were thrown completely off their balance . The animal part of [me]2122-i lived and moved as usual ; the viler animal instincts in [me]2122-i plotted and planned , and that was all . [Nobody]2485-nobody , looking at [me]2122-i , would have seen anything but a dull quietude in [my]2122-i face , an immovable composure in [my]2122-i manner . And yet [no madman]4525-no madman was fitter for restraint , or less responsible morally for [his]4525-no madman own actions , than [I]2122-i was at that moment . The night air blew more freshly on [our]4526-we faces . Still led by [the child]2711-the child , [we]4526-we had passed through [the last street]4528-the last street — [we]4526-we were out on the empty open space which was [the landward boundary of [the harbor]4224-the harbor]4529-the landward boundary of the harbor . In a minute more [we]4526-we stood on [the quay]4479-the quay , within a step of the gunwale of [the boat]2461-the boat . [I]2122-i noticed a change in the appearance of [the harbor]4224-the harbor since [I]2122-i had seen it last . [Some fishing - boats]4534-some fishing - boats had come in during [my]2122-i absence . [They]4534-some fishing - boats moored , some immediately astern and some immediately ahead of [[my]2122-i own vessel]4535-my own vessel . [I]2122-i looked anxiously to see if [any of [the fishermen]4537-the fishermen]4536-any of the fishermen were on board and stirring . [Not a living being]4538-not a living being appeared anywhere . [The men]1335-the men were on [shore]3297-shore with [[their]1335-the men wives]214-their wives and [[their]1335-the men families]4542-their families . [Elfie]139-elfie held out [her]139-elfie arms to be lifted on board [[my]2122-i boat]392-my boat . [Mrs. Van Brandt]103-mrs. van brandt stepped between [us]2124-us as [I]2122-i stooped to take [her]103-mrs. van brandt up . “[2122-i] [We]2124-us will wait here , ” [she]103-mrs. van brandt said , “[2124-us] while [you]2125-you go into [the cabin]4187-the cabin and get the money . ” Those words placed it beyond all doubt that [she]103-mrs. van brandt had [her]103-mrs. van brandt suspicions of [me]0-i — suspicions , probably , which led [her]103-mrs. van brandt to fear not for [her]103-mrs. van brandt life , but for [her]103-mrs. van brandt freedom . [She]103-mrs. van brandt might dread being kept [a prisoner]4544-a prisoner in [the boat]2461-the boat , and being carried away by [me]0-i against [her]103-mrs. van brandt will . More than this [she]103-mrs. van brandt could not thus far possibly apprehend . [The child]2711-the child saved [me]0-i the trouble of making any remonstrance . [She]2711-the child was determined to go with [me]0-i . “[0-i] [I]0-i must see [the cabin]4187-the cabin , ” [she]2711-the child cried , holding up the key . “[0-i] [I]0-i must open the door [myself]0-i . ” [She]2711-the child twisted [herself]2711-the child out of [[her]2711-the child mother]1190-her mother ’s hands , and ran round to the other side of [me]0-i . [I]0-i lifted [her]2711-the child over the gunwale of [the boat]2461-the boat in an instant . Before [I]0-i could turn round , [[her]2711-the child mother]1190-her mother had followed [her]2711-the child , and was standing on [the deck]4480-the deck . The cabin door , in the position which [she]2711-the child now occupied , was on [her]2711-the child left hand . [The child]2711-the child was close behind [her]2711-the child . [I]0-i was on [her]2711-the child right . Before [us]4552-we was [the open deck]4553-the open deck , and the low gunwale of [the boat]2461-the boat overlooking [the deep water]4555-the deep water . In a moment [we]4552-we might step across ; in a moment [we]4552-we might take the fatal plunge . The bare thought of it brought the mad wickedness in [me]0-i to its climax . [I]0-i became suddenly incapable of restraining [myself]0-i . [I]0-i threw [my]0-i arm round [her]2711-the child waist with a loud laugh . “[0-i] Come , ” [I]0-i said , trying to drag [her]2711-the child across the deck—“come[0-i] and look at [the water]326-the water . ” [She]2711-the child released [herself]2711-the child by a sudden effort of strength that astonished [me]0-i . With a faint cry of horror , [she]2711-the child turned to take [the child]2711-the child by the hand and get back to [the quay]4479-the quay . [I]0-i placed [myself]0-i between [her]2711-the child and the sides of [the boat]2461-the boat , and cut off [her]2711-the child retreat in that way . Still laughing , [I]0-i asked [her]2711-the child what [she]2711-the child was frightened about . [She]2711-the child drew back , and snatched the key of the cabin door out of [the child]2711-the child ’s hand . [The cabin]4187-the cabin was the one place of refuge now left , to which [she]2711-the child could escape from [the deck of [the boat]2461-the boat]4561-the deck of the boat . In the terror of the moment , [she]2711-the child never hesitated . [She]2711-the child unlocked the door , and hurried down the two or three steps which led into [the cabin]4187-the cabin , taking [the child]2711-the child with [her]2711-the child . [I]0-i followed [them]4565-them , conscious that [I]0-i had betrayed [myself]0-i , yet still obstinately , stupidly , madly bent on carrying out [my]0-i purpose . “[0-i] [I]0-i have only to behave quietly , ” [I]0-i thought to [myself]0-i , “[0-i] and [I]0-i shall persuade [her]2129-her to go on [deck]862-deck again . ” [My]0-i lamp was burning as [I]0-i had left it ; [my]0-i traveling - bag was on the table . Still holding [the child]2711-the child , [she]2711-the child stood , pale as death , waiting for [me]0-i . [Elfie]139-elfie ’s wondering eyes rested inquiringly on [my]0-i face as [I]0-i approached [them]4565-them . [She]139-elfie looked half inclined to cry ; the suddenness of [the mother]1743-the mother ’s action had frightened [the child]2711-the child . [I]0-i did [my]0-i best to compose [Elfie]139-elfie before [I]0-i spoke to [[her]139-elfie mother]1190-her mother . [I]0-i pointed out the different objects which were likely to interest [her]139-elfie in [the cabin]4187-the cabin . “[0-i] Go and look at them , ” [I]2131-i said , “[2131-i] go and amuse [yourself]2131-i . ” [The child]2711-the child still hesitated . “[2131-i] Are [you]2132-you angry with [me]0-i ? ” [she]139-elfie asked . “[2132-you] No , no ! ” “[2132-you] Are [you]2132-you angry with [mamma]1997-mamma ? ” “[2132-you] Certainly not . ” [I]2132-you turned to [Mrs. Van Brandt]103-mrs. van brandt . “[2132-you] Tell [Elfie]139-elfie if [I]0-i am angry with [you]139-elfie , ” [I]0-i said . [She]139-elfie was perfectly aware , in [her]139-elfie critical position , of the necessity of humoring [me]0-i . Between [us]4572-us , [we]4572-us succeeded in composing [the child]2711-the child . [She]139-elfie turned away to examine , in high delight , the new and strange objects which surrounded [her]139-elfie . Meanwhile [[her]2711-the child mother]1190-her mother and [I]0-i stood together , looking at [each other]354-each other by the light of the lamp , with an assumed composure which hid [our]4572-us true faces like a mask . In that horrible situation , the grotesque and the terrible , always together in this strange life of [ours]4572-us , came together now . On either side of [us]4572-us , the one sound that broke the sinister and threatening silence was the lumpish snoring of [the sleeping captain]4576-the sleeping captain and [crew]2944-crew . [She]139-elfie was the first to speak . “[0-i] If [you]2134-you wish to give [me]0-i the money , ” [she]139-elfie said , trying to propitiate [me]2134-you in that way , “[2134-you] [I]0-i am ready to take it now . ” [I]0-i unlocked [my]0-i traveling - bag . As [I]0-i looked into it for the leather case which held [my]0-i money , [my]0-i overpowering desire to get [her]139-elfie on [deck]862-deck again , [my]0-i mad impatience to commit the fatal act , became too strong to be controlled . “[0-i] [We]2135-us shall be cooler on [deck]862-deck , ” [I]0-i said . “[0-i] Let [us]2135-us take the bag up there . ” [She]139-elfie showed wonderful courage . [I]2135-us could almost see the cry for help rising to [her]139-elfie lips . [She]139-elfie repressed it ; [she]139-elfie had still presence of mind enough to foresee what might happen before [she]139-elfie could rouse [the sleeping men]4579-the sleeping men . “[2135-us] [We]2135-us have a light here to count the money by , ” [she]139-elfie answered . “[2135-us] [I]0-i do n’t feel at all too warm in [the cabin]4187-the cabin . Let [us]2135-us stay [here]586-here a little longer . See how [Elfie]139-elfie is amusing [herself]139-elfie ! ” [Her]139-elfie eyes rested on [me]139-elfie as [she]139-elfie spoke . Something in the expression of [them]4579-the sleeping men quieted [me]139-elfie for the time . [I]139-elfie was able to pause and think . [I]139-elfie might take [her]139-elfie on [deck]862-deck by force before [the men]1335-the men could interfere . But [her]139-elfie cries would rouse [them]1335-the men ; [they]1335-the men would hear the splash in the water , and [they]1335-the men might be quick enough to rescue [us]2135-us . It would be wiser , perhaps , to wait a little and trust to [my]139-elfie cunning to delude [her]139-elfie into leaving [the cabin]4187-the cabin of [her]139-elfie own accord . [I]139-elfie put the bag back on the table , and began to search for the leather money - case . [My]139-elfie hands were strangely clumsy and helpless . [I]139-elfie could only find the case after scattering half the contents of the bag on the table . [The child]2711-the child was near [me]139-elfie at the time , and noticed what [I]139-elfie was doing . “[139-elfie] Oh , how awkward [you]2139-you are ! ” [she]2711-the child burst out , in [her]2711-the child frankly fearless way . “[139-elfie] Let [me]0-i put [your]2139-you bag tidy . Do , please ! ” [I]139-elfie granted the request impatiently . [Elfie]139-elfie ’s restless desire to be always doing something , instead of amusing [me]139-elfie , as usual , irritated [me]139-elfie now . The interest that [I]139-elfie had once felt in [the charming little creature]351-the charming little creature was all gone . An innocent love was a feeling that was stifled in the poisoned atmosphere of [my]139-elfie mind that night . The money [I]139-elfie had with [me]139-elfie was mostly composed of notes of [the Bank of [England]1-england]71-the bank of england . Carefully keeping up appearances , [I]139-elfie set aside the sum that would probably be required to take [a traveler]4585-a traveler back to [London]2-london ; and [I]139-elfie put all that remained into the hands of [Mrs. Van Brandt]103-mrs. van brandt . Could [she]2140-her suspect [me]139-elfie of a design on [her]2140-her life now ? “[139-elfie] That will do for the present , ” [I]139-elfie said . “[139-elfie] [I]0-i can communicate with [you]2140-her in the future through [Messrs. Van Brandt]136-messrs. van brandt , of [Amsterdam]61-amsterdam . ” [She]2140-her took the money mechanically . [Her]2140-her hand trembled ; [her]2140-her eyes met [mine]139-elfie with a look of piteous entreaty . [She]2140-her tried to revive [my]136-messrs. van brandt old tenderness for [her]2140-her ; [she]2140-her made a last appeal to [my]136-messrs. van brandt forbearance and consideration . “[136-messrs. van brandt] [We]2141-we may part [friends]3384-friends , ” [she]2140-her said , in low , trembling tones . “[2141-we] And as [friends]3384-friends [we]2141-we may meet again , when time has taught [you]0-i to think forgivingly of what has passed between [us]2141-we , to - night . ” [She]2140-her offered [me]2141-we [her]2140-her hand . [I]2141-we looked at [her]2140-her without taking it . [I]2141-we penetrated [her]2140-her motive in appealing to [my]2141-we old regard for [her]2140-her . Still suspecting [me]2141-we , [she]2140-her had tried [her]2140-her last chance of getting safely on [shore]3297-shore . “[2141-we] The less [we]2141-we say of the past , the better , ” [I]2141-we answered , with ironical politeness . “[2141-we] It is getting late . And [you]0-i will agree with [me]0-i that [Elfie]139-elfie ought to be in [her]139-elfie bed . ” [I]0-i looked round at [the child]2711-the child . “[0-i] Be quick , [Elfie]139-elfie , ” [I]139-elfie said ; “[139-elfie] [[your]139-elfie mamma]1750-your mamma is going away . ” [I]1750-your mamma opened [the cabin]4187-the cabin door , and offered [my]1750-your mamma arm to [Mrs. Van Brandt]103-mrs. van brandt . “[1750-your mamma] [This boat]2145-this boat is [[my]0-i house]576-my house for the time being , ” [I]1750-your mamma resumed . “[1750-your mamma] When [ladies]2147-ladies take leave of [me]0-i after a visit , [I]0-i escort [them]2147-ladies to [the dock]2148-the dock . [Pray]140-pray take [my]0-i arm . ” [She]0-i started back . For the second time [she]0-i was on the point of crying for help , and for the second time [she]0-i kept that last desperate alternative in reserve . “[140-pray] [I]0-i have n’t seen [[your]0-i cabin]2149-your cabin yet , ” [she]0-i said , [her]0-i eyes wild with fear , a forced smile on [her]0-i lips , as [she]0-i spoke . “[0-i] There are several little things here that interest [me]0-i . Give [me]0-i another minute or two to look at them . ” [She]0-i turned away to get nearer to [the child]2711-the child , under pretense of looking round [the cabin]4187-the cabin . [I]0-i stood on guard before the open door , watching [her]0-i . [She]0-i made a second pretense : [she]0-i noisily overthrew a chair as if by accident , and then waited to discover whether [her]0-i trick had succeeded in waking [the men]1335-the men . The heavy snoring went on ; not a sound of [a person]3531-a person moving was audible on either side of [us]4593-us . “[0-i] [[My]0-i men]2150-my men are [heavy sleepers]2151-heavy sleepers , ” [I]0-i said , smiling significantly . “[0-i] Do n’t be alarmed ; [you]0-i have not disturbed [them]2150-my men . Nothing wakes [these Dutch sailors]2152-these dutch sailors when [they]2150-my men are once safe in port . ” [She]0-i made no reply . [My]1997-mamma patience was exhausted . [I]1997-mamma left the door and advanced toward [her]0-i . [She]0-i retreated in speechless terror , passing behind the table to the other end of [the cabin]4187-the cabin . [I]1997-mamma followed [her]0-i until [she]0-i had reached the extremity of [the room]185-the room and could get no further . [She]0-i met the look [I]1997-mamma fixed on [her]0-i ; [she]0-i shrunk into a corner , and called for help . In the deadly terror that possessed [her]0-i , [she]0-i lost the use of [her]0-i voice . A low moaning , hardly louder than a whisper , was all that passed [her]0-i lips . Already , in imagination , [I]1997-mamma stood with [her]0-i on the gunwale , already [I]1997-mamma felt the cold contact of the water — when [I]1997-mamma was startled by a cry behind [me]1997-mamma . [I]1997-mamma turned round . The cry had come from [Elfie]139-elfie . [She]139-elfie had apparently just discovered some new object in the bag , and [she]139-elfie was holding it up in admiration , high above [her]139-elfie head . “[1997-mamma] [Mamma]1997-mamma ! [mamma]1997-mamma ! ” [the child]2711-the child cried , excitedly , “[1997-mamma] look at this pretty thing ! Oh , do , do ask [him]2155-him if [I]0-i may have it ! ” [[Her]2711-the child mother]1190-her mother ran to [her]2711-the child , eager to seize the poorest excuse for getting away from [me]1997-mamma . [I]1997-mamma followed ; [I]1997-mamma stretched out [my]1997-mamma hands to seize [her]139-elfie . [She]139-elfie suddenly turned round on [me]1997-mamma , [a woman transformed]4598-a woman transformed . A bright flush was on [her]139-elfie face , an eager wonder sparkled in [her]139-elfie eyes . Snatching [Elfie]139-elfie ’s coveted object out of [the child]2711-the child ’s hand , [she]139-elfie held it up before [me]1997-mamma . [I]1997-mamma saw it under the lamp - light . It was [my]1997-mamma little forgotten keepsake — the Green Flag ! “[1997-mamma] How came [you]2156-me by this ? ” [she]139-elfie asked , in breathless anticipation of [my]1997-mamma reply . Not the slightest trace was left in [her]139-elfie face of the terror that had convulsed it barely a minute since ! “[1997-mamma] How came [you]2156-me by this ? ” [she]139-elfie repeated , seizing [me]2156-me by the arm and shaking [me]2156-me , in the ungovernable impatience that possessed [her]139-elfie . [My]2156-me head turned giddy , [my]2156-me heart beat furiously under the conflict of emotions that [she]139-elfie had roused in [me]2156-me . [My]2156-me eyes were riveted on the green flag . The words that [I]2156-me wanted to speak were words that refused to come to [me]2156-me . [I]2156-me answered , mechanically : “[2156-me] [I]0-i have had it since [I]0-i was [a boy]2242-a boy . ” [She]139-elfie dropped [her]139-elfie hold on [me]2156-me , and lifted [her]139-elfie hands with a gesture of ecstatic gratitude . A lovely , angelic brightness flowed like light from heaven over [her]139-elfie face . For one moment [she]139-elfie stood enraptured . The next [she]139-elfie clasped [me]2156-me passionately to [her]139-elfie bosom , and whispered in [my]2156-me ear : “[2156-me] [I]0-i am [Mary Dermody]85-mary ! [I]0-i made it for [You]0-i ! ” The shock of discovery , following so closely on all that [I]0-i had suffered before it , was too much for [me]0-i . [I]0-i sank , fainting , in [her]139-elfie arms . When [I]0-i came to [myself]0-i [I]0-i was lying on [my]0-i bed in [the cabin]4187-the cabin . [Elfie]139-elfie was playing with the green flag , and [Mary]85-mary was sitting by [me]0-i with [my]0-i hand in [hers]85-mary . One long look of love passed silently from [her]139-elfie eyes to [mine]0-i — from [mine]0-i to [hers]139-elfie . In that look [the kindred spirits]511-the kindred spirits were united ; The Two Destinies were fulfilled . THERE was a little introductory narrative prefixed to “[0-i] The Two Destinies , ” which [you]4602-you may possibly have forgotten by this time . The narrative was written by [myself]141-mary germaine — [a citizen of [the United States]8-the united states]4603-a citizen of the united states , visiting [England]1-england with [[his]4603-a citizen of the united states wife]215-his wife . It described a dinner - party at which [we]4605-we were present , given by [Mr.]4606-mr. and [Mrs. Germaine]75-mrs. germaine , in celebration of [their]4607-their marriage ; and it mentioned the circumstances under which [we]4605-we were intrusted with the story which has just come to an end in these pages . Having read the manuscript , [Mr.]4608-mr. and [Mrs. Germaine]75-mrs. germaine left it to [us]4605-we to decide whether [we]4605-we should continue [our]4605-we friendly intercourse with [them]4607-their or not . At 3 o’clock P.M. [we]4605-we closed the last leaf of the story . Five minutes later [I]141-mary germaine sealed it up in its cover ; [[my]141-mary germaine wife]144-my wife put [her]144-my wife bonnet on , and there [we]4605-we were , bound straight for [[Mr. Germaine]74-mr. germaine ’s house]4610-mr. germaine ’s house , when [the servant]2295-the servant brought a letter into [the room]185-the room , addressed to [[my]141-mary germaine wife]144-my wife . [She]144-my wife opened it , looked at the signature , and discovered that it was “[141-mary germaine] [Mary Germaine]141-mary germaine . ” Seeing this , [we]4605-we sat down side by side to read the letter before [we]4605-we did anything else . On reflection , it strikes [me]2985-dear madam that [you]2985-dear madam may do well to read it , too . [Mrs. Germaine]75-mrs. germaine is surely by this time [a person in whom [you]2985-dear madam feel some interest]4614-a person in whom you feel some interest . And [she]75-mrs. germaine is on that account , as [I]2985-dear madam think , [the fittest person to close the story]4615-the fittest person to close the story . When [you]2985-dear madam read these lines [we]2159-we shall have left [London]2-london for [the Continent]29-the continent . “ After [you]2985-dear madam went away last night , [[my]2985-dear madam husband]2225-my husband decided on taking this journey .
